characters: ANGEL AND GUY WITH BURNED FACE
DOOR OF BANK PRESIDENT, MATTHEW WICKER
THE ANGEL AND ANNABELLE AND THE OTHERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocks. Cactus. 1 The occasional tree. Not a place you'd like to spend your summer vacation. Now there are sounds: A WHIPPING WIND begins to get LOUDER. And in the distance, but GROWING: THUNDER. CAMERA STARTS TO MOVE -SLOWLY, INEXORABLY, ACROSS this de We are in a Sergio Leone TIGHT CLOSEUP of just a hideousl wanders. CAMERA MOVES AGAIN. The wind is really kicking up --- suddenly, another STOP. Another Leone CLOSEUP. A second man. This guy makes the first one look handsome. Both his eyes work, which is an improvement. But his neck has been horribly burned as if from a noose. CAMERA IS MOVING AGAIN. LOUDER THUNDER. A storm is coming fast. CAMERA STOPS. We are LOOKING AT the least appetizing of the three. that he's scarred, not that all his parts aren't in proper working order -- it's just that he's so damn frightening. Not Not to mention huge. This is THE ANGEL and like the other two, he is seated on a horse. And he is staring intently at something. FROM The Angel -- we go to...

dialogues.speaker: BRET MAVERICK
dialogues.text: for this is who the trio is looking at. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 1 MAVERICK's 30, give or take. Enormously appealing. Whether that's because of his considerable physical skills or his sunny personality, who knows. It might be his quiet wit. In any case, we are looking at a handsome young man that everybody likes --- oops --- make that almost everybody. Because just now he is seated on a horse beneath a tree and a thick hope has been tied around his neck, the rope thrown over a branch. His hands have been tied behind his back. We are about to watch a hanging. His.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: (riding closer) I almost got hung myself once, didn't much care for it, how about you? (as Maverick says nothing) We're gonna leave now, but I'm worried about your well-being. Maverick just stares at him, makes no reply.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: He gestures for the other two to ride, and they take off.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: See, I don't think it's a good thing for a man to be alone out here. Your mind can do cruel things. And now he takes a burlap sack, tosses it toward Maverick. It lands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Enjoy the company. He spurs his horse, rides away.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: managing to turn his head in the direction The Angel took. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL AND OTHER TWO
dialogues.text: disappearing over a nearby hill. 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky. 3 2 Storm clouds convene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 Maverick. He takes a deep breath, tries to wriggle free of the knotted rope around his neck. No luck. Make that bad luck. The horse has been surprised by his movement, takes a half step.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Freezing.

dialogues.speaker: HORSE
dialogues.text: It relaxes, settles down. 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4 The sky, and a THUNDERCLAP. 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick, staring at his horse. 5 The noise was loud. Either the horse is deaf or it likes thunder. budge an inch. Doesn't Maverick starts to try and work his neck free again. This time the horse doesn't move at all. Maverick sighs with relief, glances around.

dialogues.speaker: BURLAP SACK
dialogues.text: It is starting to wriggle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He holds his breath.

dialogues.speaker: HORSE
dialogues.text: It hasn't spotted the sack yet.

dialogues.speaker: SACK
dialogues.text: Wriggling more. not to spot it. Pretty soon it's going to be hard

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: caution to the winds now, trying desperately to somehow get free of the noose --- and miraculously, he's headway.

dialogues.speaker: HORSE
dialogues.text: Calm. Nothing flusters this animal.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: even more headway -- he's in pain but he ignores it. 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky. 7 More THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horse. 8 6 7 Standing still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8 The clouds are darker. 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horse. 9 It could be a statue.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: one eye on the sack as he continues to work to free his neck. Now -SACK as a rattlesnake peeks out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 9 5.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: HORSE
dialogues.text: Oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: SACK
dialogues.text: Half-a-dozen rattlers are moving out of the sack now. Close by. Some of them are big, some of them are very big. All of them have fangs.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: struggling harder than ever, and he's actually making more headway. It's exhausting labor. As he continues his fight for life -MAVERICK (V.O.) It had been just a shitty week for me from the beginning. Now, FROM that -9A

dialogues.speaker: 9A
dialogues.text: A lone rider rides through dusty area up and down dips in the road. It is Maverick. He rides a mule. Angel follows and then Coop follows.

dialogues.speaker: 9B
dialogues.text: Maverick rides his mule along dusty trail; as we PAN WITH him a wagon train travels in opposite direction; kids play poker in the f.g. -- one smokes a corn cob pipe; we CONTINUE PAN WITH Maverick and REVEAL the town of Crystal River, a ferry coming across the river in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was heading into Crystal River to take some money from the bank. Probably I should have expected bad luck on the horizon when my horse got stolen and I had to replace it with something less than a thoroughbred. 10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 Crystal River. Not much of a place. Dusty. One main street -- and almost every storefront indicates that it is either a saloon or a gambling hall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 10 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 Just now the stagecoach comes off the ferry and drives through town kicking up dust.

dialogues.speaker: 10A
dialogues.text: Maverick, riding into town from the other direction, as the dust whips up. He's wearing different clothes than in the hanging scene.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My luck had to change fast -- the poker game of the century was starting in St. Louis in just ten days, and I was still short three thousand for the entrance fee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 Maverick rides toward the bank, stops. indicates "Closed 'til Morning." A sign in front

dialogues.speaker: 11B
dialogues.text: A stable as Maverick dismounts, does his best to beat some dust from his riding clothes. He grabs his saddlebag as a STABLE BOY hurries up.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (indicating the mule) How much?

dialogues.speaker: STABLE BOY
dialogues.text: By the day, week or month?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: No-no -- Not how much to take care of him, how much to just take him. Permanently.

dialogues.speaker: STABLE BOY
dialogues.text: Pa. The man wants to sell the burro.

dialogues.speaker: PA
dialogues.text: That burro's not worth a cent. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You just made yourself a fine deal. (they shake) How 'bout the saddle?

dialogues.speaker: PA
dialogues.text: Five dollars.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Five dollars. Nice doing business with you. Thank you. He doesn't eat much. He's a regular jackass ... Hee... haw... Hee... haw. Always likes to be called Arthur. He opens the door. He bumps into Angel. They look at each other. Maverick exits and Angel looks and moves inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 The biggest establishment in town. This place actually has a second floor and advertises rooms as well as vices. 13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 Maverick is starting up the stairs when the REGISTRATION CLERK hurries over from his desk.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: You got a wire, want me to read it to you?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (reaching for it) No.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (reading) It just says, 'Watch your back.' (beat) No signature. (hands it over) Here. Maverick takes it, glances at it, heads upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town and river look beautiful as the sun is going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 The place is busy enough, the bar doing a brisk business. A poker game is in session. Half a dozen play. A cattlehand, a preacher, a small-time local businessman. But it's the other three we pay most attention to. First is a very young man. Late teens, looks less. Thin. Small. A hundred and thirty pounds after a big meal. This is THE KID. Seems ordinary. Next to him sits, of all things, a woman. But not ordinary, certainly not in these surroundings. She's elegantly-dressed, close to being beautiful. She's married, has a deep Southern accent, and hasn't been poor for a long time. Maybe she's thirty. She seems a rotten poker player, but a wonderful flirt. This is ANNABELLE BRANSFORD. Next to her sits The Angel. We met him already -- he tossed the burlap bag of rattlesnakes at Maverick just before the hanging. Huge, powerful, not much makes him smile, except winning at cards. There is an empty seat at the table.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: as Maverick descends. If before he was grimy from travel, he isn't anymore. He wears a black hat, a black jacket, a black string tie --- and just the most beautifu saw.

dialogues.speaker: POKER GAME
dialogues.text: as Maverick approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (indicating the empty chair) Taken?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (lilting Southern accent) It is now. (smiles at him) My name is Annabelle Bransford. And what do people call you?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Bret Maverick, ma'm. And as he starts to sit -(CONTINUED)  8. 14

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: glaring at Maverick. he'll hang Maverick. (We know that within a week, But they haven't met before.)

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: I like the game the way it is.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I bring all kinds of plusses to the table. I hardly ever bluff and I never ever cheat.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Neither do I.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: (voice rising, not in pitch, but intensity) I like the game just the way it is.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Bet I can change your mind. (beat) I promise to lose for at least an hour.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: (without a pause) We're playing five card draw. As Maverick sits -MAVERICK losing a hand to The Angel. The Angel smiles -- -- but so does Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: losing again, this time to Annabelle. She's happy -- -- but again, so is Maverick. And now we begin a SERIES of VERY QUICK CUTS. Of The kid, holding his cards. Tightly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14 Of the cattleman casually making a bet. Very casually. Of Maverick, who doesn't seem to be paying much attention. He loses again, smiles. Now the preacher is staring at his cards before betting. For a long beat. And the cattleman is fiddling with his chips. The chips in front of The Angel are sloppy. The chips in front of Annabelle are neatly stacked. She flicks her fingernails against her front teeth, makes a bet. The businessman is toying with his necktie. The Angel is holding his cards, moving the top to the bottom, then repeating, the top to the bottom. And Maverick loses again, smiles again, just happy to be there. Annabelle is suddenly helpless, giggling, staring at what she's been dealt. The Angel is smiling happily. He rakes in a pot. The businessman's fingers are tapping on the table. The Kid's hand covers his mouth. The Angel is bored, looking neither at the other players or the pot. Annabelle bets big and wins -- maybe she's not such a rotten poker player after all. Maverick tosses in his cards. Another loss. He smiles, glances at the clock on the wall -- an hour and a half have gone by.

dialogues.speaker: 14A
dialogues.text: It is getting dark. Fewer people move about. A lamplighte

dialogues.speaker: 14B
dialogues.text: The table. Maverick and the kid are the last two in the game. The kid turns his cards over. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 14B
dialogues.text: Two pair, aces over queens. Maverick has three sixes. He looks at his winning hand almost in surprise. It's a good sized pot he's won. As he reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: THE KID
dialogues.text: (mumbling something) Don't think... The rest is unintelligible.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Didn't get you.

dialogues.speaker: THE KID
dialogues.text: I said I don't think that hand should count.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You got any logical reasons going for you?

dialogues.speaker: THE KID
dialogues.text: My mind wasn't on the game. His voice is always soft.

dialogues.speaker: THE KID
dialogues.text: He stares at Maverick and something is suddenly clear: His eyes are deadly.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Hesitating now.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What's your name, son?

dialogues.speaker: THE KID
dialogues.text: Johnny Hardin.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: And what do you do for a living?

dialogues.speaker: THE KID
dialogues.text: Oh, mostly I kill people. gunfighter. I'm a

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Since you're still alive, I have to assume you're good at it.

dialogues.speaker: THE KID
dialogues.text: Care to find out? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (a beat -- then) This hand definitely does not count. (indicating chips) Take whatever you think's yours, I'll be content with the leavings. As The Kid does -ANNABELLE A quick look of disappointment crosses her face.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: A look of contempt crosses his.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: You always been gutless?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (thinks a minute -then nods) I think so. At least for as long as I can remember. My pappy always said, 'He who fights and runs away, can run away another day.' (now he stands -like every other man in the room, he wears a six gun) Here's the truth -- I don't see what's so great about being brave. Pulls back his black jacket, clearing his gun.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Watching. His hand begins to move to his gun.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: This is not a nice place.

dialogues.speaker: TABLE
dialogues.text: All watching Maverick now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (chatting idly away) See, you're a gunfighter and I'm not, I like to play cards, so the fact is, if I'd faced you down, what chance would I have had? Answer? Zero.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: suddenly he draws -- and it's lightning -- you never saw anyone so fast.

dialogues.speaker: THE KID
dialogues.text: Stunned.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: His voice casual.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: No chance whatsoever. And now he expertly twirls his gun back into its holster.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Leaning toward The Kid.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Was that fast? (as The Kid manages a nod) I thought it was fast.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: sitting back down at the table again. This has all gone quickly and quietly. Now he looks at The Kid.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: May I suggest that from now on you keep your mind on the game?

dialogues.speaker: THE KID
dialogues.text: Yes. Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: My deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Not remotely afraid of Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: You say you like to play cards?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Passionately.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: How come, when you lose all the time?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't lose all the time -just the first hour or so. for people to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: What happens after that?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Probably I'll win all your money.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Aren't you a little overconfident?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: No. I've just been here before.

dialogues.speaker: POKER GAME BEGINNING AGAIN
dialogues.text: And again, we see a SERIES OF VERY QUICK CUTS. In fact, we see many of the same cuts we saw before -only The Kid holds his cards tightly. Too tightly. He makes a bet. Maverick doubles it. The Kid folds. He was bluffing. The Cattleman casually makes a bet. Very casually. Maverick doubles it. Another bluff. Maverick wins again. Annabelle is suddenly helpless, giggling. Maverick folds. The others bet. wasn't bluffing. Annabelle wins -- she The Angel is guarding his cards with both huge hands. He makes a big bet. Maverick makes a bigger one. The Angel folds. Angrily. He was bluffing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 14B
dialogues.text: The Businessman is playing with his tie. He bets. Maverick makes a big raise. The Businessman calls. both have good hands. But Maverick's is better. They The Angel is bored, makes a bet looking at neither the other players nor the pot. Maverick makes a big bet. The Angel throws his cards down, his anger building as he was caught in another bluff.

dialogues.speaker: CLOCK
dialogues.text: Time is passing.

dialogues.speaker: POKER GAME
dialogues.text: Maverick has cleaned out everybody but The Angel. The Angel hesitates, moving the top card to the bottom, does it again, moves the top card to the bottom --- now h Now Maverick makes a bet. A huge bet.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: scowling, staring.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Nothing shows on his face. He just waits. Then --

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: He wants to bet but you can tell it in his eyes -- he's scared he's not strong enough.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: The others are watching. Annabelle smiles at him. politely touches the rim of his hat. He

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: he hurls his cards to the table. Maverick wins.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: putting his cards face down, starting to collect the pot.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: suddenly reaching out, grabbing Maverick's cards, turning them over -(CONTINUED)  15.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK'S CARDS
dialogues.text: He has shit. Not even a pair. This time he was bluffing.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: on his feet with a roar -THE ANGEL You said you never bluffed!

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (very calm, collecting the pot) No, I said I never cheated, and I don't. I also said I hardly ever bluffed. This was one of the 'hardlys.'

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: You cheated the whole goddam game.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What do you think I was doing that first hour? Learning your 'tells,' that's all. Once I could read your hands, once I could read you -(shrugs) -- things just kind of worked out.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: I just called you a 'cheat.'

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You also called me gutless. figured you were teasing --

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: blind mad. He reaches his huge arms across, starts to grab Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 FOUR UNSHAVEN BIG MEN bursting through the front door of the place, the LEAD GUY has his gun drawn -LEAD GUY (to The Angel) Get away from him -- we get him first -(CONTINUED)  16. 15

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: and he's not so casual now. His eyes flick around, looking for a place to move.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR UNSHAVEN BIG MEN
dialogues.text: Three of them fanning out behind the Lead Guy, blocking anyplace Maverick might go.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUY
dialogues.text: I spotted ya through the window and it made me believe in The Almighty.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You fellas were drinking, you played bad, whose fault is that?

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUY
dialogues.text: Yours, bastard -- everything is your fault. (beat) But it's our time come now. They advance.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: suddenly vaulting the card table, heading for the swinging front doors -FOUR GUYS and for just a moment they're surprised.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: taking advantage of the moment, sprinting away and -FOUR realizing now, turning, starting after him and -MAVERICK blasting through the swinging doors and outside and -THE out onto the saloon's porch to watch.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR GUYS
dialogues.text: bolting from the bar and as they leave -CUT TO:  MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 16 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 outside, racing away --- and then he does a surprising th He stops.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL AND ANNABELLE AND THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: rivited.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR GUYS
dialogues.text: outside -- they stop too.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He turns now, turns to face them.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL AND OTHERS
dialogues.text: watching as the Four Guys stare at Maverick, wary, ready for anything.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Hey, son. Take this. If they get to whooping me, just shoot me. Take care of this and make sure it doesn't get dirty. And now he does something else surprising. He takes off his gun belt and his coat and gives them to the boys.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR GUYS
dialogues.text: Three of them look to the Lead Guy. his gun belt too. He hesitates, drops

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now the Four Men begin to move slowly toward Maverick

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Four of them and all of them dangerous, four of them coming closer in the night. And now he does the most surprising thing of all: He charges them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 16 17A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cracks whip.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUY
dialogues.text: You gamblin' scum. I'm gonna cut you up. They're surprised and then --

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: as he just explodes -(CONTINUED)  18. 16

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 16 -- because if he was fast when he drew his gun, he's faster in a fight -- faster and fearless and as he wades in -ANNABELLE watching. Eyes bright.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: watching, stunned at what he's seeing out there in the night, and -MAVERICK spinning, throwing an elbow into the gut of the nearest big man. The blow connects perfectly and the Guy starts to double over, his knees weak, and he falls.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND BIG MAN
dialogues.text: swinging viciously and he knows how to use his fists ---

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: ducking the blow, coming up with a punch of his own that lands on the side of the jaw and the guy staggers back and down.

dialogues.speaker: THE KID
dialogues.text: watching and probably he's never seen anything like this, one guy attacking four.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: and for just a moment now, as he stares out almost in disbelief, there's something new behind his eyes: Fear.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: leaving his feet, kicking out with both legs at the third guy, crunching him in the chest, sending him careening back, cartwheeling to earth.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUY
dialogues.text: diving at Maverick from behind, and for a moment he's got him, his arms tight around Maverick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 16

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: and the instant this happens, he lets his body go totally limp so the Lead Guy is left having to hold him up, and he hadn't expected this and as Maverick sags -LEAD GUY stunned as suddenly Maverick stiffens, tosses the Lead Guy over his head and through the air where he lands, hard.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: moving back on the First Guy, the one he creamed the air out of and as he approaches, the First Guy turns, runs.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUY
dialogues.text: on his feet running too.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: watching as all four take off into the night. Maverick picks up his gun belt, straps it on as he heads back toward the frontier. 17

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 17 enters. He seems remarkably calm, considering what he's just done. Breathing heavily, sure, a little dusty, absolutely, but no more. Annabelle hurries to him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: That was the most amazing thing.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Sometimes you get lucky is all. And as he walks forward -MIRROR as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: a glance --- and then he stops dead -(CONTINUED)  20. 17

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 17 -- now he moves forward --- he touches his beautiful ruff

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: A look of blind fury is there.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: watching, as Maverick storms toward him.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: All right -- my shirt's damaged, what the hell else bad can happen? -(pointing to The Angel) -- you were saying something?

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: (pacifying) -- Nothing, nothing, wasn't important -ANNABELLE (thinking back) -- Didn't you call him a gutless coward? -- I'm pretty sure that was it.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: (sweating) -- never said such a thing -gutless cheat, yes, but I wou never call a man a coward -(hopefully) -- and I was teasing. Maverick studies the bigger man for a moment. amiably -- Then,

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (as he sits) Let's play poker. 18

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 Maverick in his room, still in his gambling attire. He is finishing counting his considerable cash winnings as a KNOCK comes on his door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 18 21.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 18 He folds the cash into his jacket pocket, moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Annabelle Bransford.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: as he opens it and there she is, stunning as ever, standi can almost feel her Southern heart pounding.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I... I shouldn't be doing this.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You're just standing in the hallway, Mrs. Bransford -- I think that's still legal in this state.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: moving quickly into his room. She closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: If only I weren't married -And with that she goes into hi

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: -- I couldn't help myself. My very being cried out for me to hold you.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Stop by anytime.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Eyes so bright.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: We'll likely never see each other again so it's safe for me to tell you -- you're the most blindingly attractive man I've ever seen. (her cheek brushes his) And now good-bye. She takes a step toward the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 18

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He is a healthy young man and this is a woman of passion and beauty. He reaches out, gently takes her hand, speaks soft, his voice husky.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: ... Annabelle...?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: all but trembling. There is a long pause. Then --

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He kisses her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: How can I go on without my wallet? ... if you don't give me back my money, I'll have your ass thrown in jail. Hand it over.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Shocked. Hurt.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He snaps his fingers sharply. He isn't kidding around.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: as she realizes this.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Damn. And with that, she takes the wallet she's heisted from his coat, slaps it angrily into his hand. He puts it back into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Don't get mad at me -- I can't help it you're a miserable thief.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I'm a good thief, mister -- I'm just having a run of bad luck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 18

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I know about those -(studies her) -- where you from? Your accent could use a little work too.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (still using the accent) Most men enjoy my southern accent.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I love it. And there isn't a Mister Bransford, is there?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: No there isn't. And never will be, thank you very much. (looks at him) What happens now? (as he shrugs) You're not going to turn me in?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I should, I'm a law abiding citizen, but what the hell. I got my money back. Let's call it square.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You're going to let me go?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'm just having mercy on the Sheriff, is all.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (crossing to the door and slamming it as he nods, a beat) Damn.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You -- you irritate me -- you're just so... (looking for the word) ... likeable.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'll work on that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 18

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: There you go doing it again. Being likeable. You know what I think? -- if we'd met under different circumstances, we'd have just hated each other. There is not Mrs. Maverick, is there?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'm sure I would have remembered.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I can be likeable too. (quickly now, she comes into his arms) I wish we'd never met. Good-bye. See?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Good-bye. A quick embrace, a kiss on the cheek. goes to the door. They separate. She

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Touched. Alone now, he reaches into his pocket for his money, it isn't there --- she's robbed him again -MAVERICK Son-of-a-bitch. -- he breaks out laughing -- opens door, looks and takes off. 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle, in her room, hurriedly finishing packing. She takes her suitcase, goes to the window, opens it, steps out onto the fire escape. It's clumsy going.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Can I be of help? 20

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 The balcony and Maverick, dressed as before, waiting. She slaps him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 20 25.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (sighs, hands him his money back) You've got to admit, I was better the second time.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Not just better -- good. No, no. Not just good... very good.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Now it's time for you to do something I want.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Don't you dare. I'm a lady. Not in a million years... not if I was 100. Not if you were 100.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Shut up, lady. I don't want to go to bed with you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Why not?... I'd be too frightened -What if I dozed off? G what parts of me you'd steal. I'd wake up with things missing. (indicating his smudged shirt) But obviously I can't clean this, and obviously you must know how to. The laundry is closed and I'm leaving early, and you do owe me. Take it easy on the starch. Annabelle smiles as he takes off his shirt, her Southern accent back again.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: If I can't touch you, I can touch your shirt... and dream.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Would you like some help? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 20

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 She nods yes and begins back in -- Maverick pushes and she pushes plops back inside. He begins to walk -remember

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Goodnight... (pause) ... Bert.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (he hates that -correcting promptly) Bret. And as he goes -21

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22 as Maverick, dressed for travel, heads for the bank. He's in a good mood and why not? -- it's a gorgeous day.

dialogues.speaker: BANK
dialogues.text: Small. 23 Quiet. Several horses tied outside.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR OF BANK PRESIDENT, MATTHEW WICKER
dialogues.text: 23 Maverick is with an ELDERLY CLERK who points to the door, leaves. As soon as Maverick is alone, he draws his gun, bursts into the office.

dialogues.speaker: WICKER
dialogues.text: stunned, just stares.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: cocks his gun, gestures for Wicker to raise his hands.

dialogues.speaker: WICKER
dialogues.text: a distinguished looking man, slowly rises, his hands goin into the air.

dialogues.speaker: WICKER
dialogues.text: (suddenly speaking in a high pitched voice, like a heroine in a melodrama) Oh no, please do not hurt me, please, I'm just a frail flower, have mercy -He is stopped as the Elderly Clerk looks in f door.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY CLERK
dialogues.text: Robbery -WICKER (closing the door) No -- no, it's not a robbery, that's just Maverick saying hello. (to Maverick) C'mere, you silly son of a bitch. He embraces Maverick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Hey, Matty, everything going good?

dialogues.speaker: WICKER
dialogues.text: (sour) Couldn't be worse. (dead honest) Bret, I owe you a thousand dollars, I've got maybe a hundred. (takes out a bill) I never welched on a debt in my life. Give me to the end of the year.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I need it now.

dialogues.speaker: WICKER
dialogues.text: It's that poker championship, I knew it -- what's the entry fee, twenty five thousand? Maverick nods.

dialogues.speaker: WICKER
dialogues.text: Jesus, kid, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Porkchop Slim owed me too, but he died. Widow used my thousand for the funeral.

dialogues.speaker: WICKER
dialogues.text: I heard he was cremated.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: The Widow Porkchop conned me? (stunned) What is it with people nowadays?

dialogues.speaker: WICKER
dialogues.text: I feel the same way -- it's hard to trust anybody. They are by the door. Wicker opens it -- -- and a masked man is pointing a gun at them.

dialogues.speaker: WICKER
dialogues.text: My God, there is a robbery. The masked man grabs Maverick's hundred, frisks Wicker, takes a huge wad of bills from his inside pocket. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you were broke.

dialogues.speaker: WICKER
dialogues.text: I am now.

dialogues.speaker: OUTLAW
dialogues.text: (lighting a fuse to dynamite on the safe) Here we go. And he ducks.

dialogues.speaker: 23B
dialogues.text: WINDOWS BLOW; the door is blown off hinges; smoke billows. Maverick, appearing through the smoke. blind. Coughing, half The four guys he clobbered the night before are waiting. They look more menacing in the daylight. Maverick sees them, cuts into an alley by the bank. The four guys are right behind him. Maverick moves quickly into shadow. The four guys spread out, start to surround him. smiles. Nobody

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Anybody see you?

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUY
dialogues.text: Not a soul. Maverick turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You guys come in any later last night, that monster would have eaten me alive.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUY
dialogues.text: Anyone suspect anything? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) You were great -- couldn't have gone better.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUY
dialogues.text: Truth is, we enjoyed it. for going so easy on us. Thanks

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Damn. Those were my best shots. (beat) What'd we agree on, five dollars a beating? (as the Lead Guy nods Maverick unpins a hundred dollar bill from inside his shirt) Who's got change? Easy? They all AD LIB about money, the deal, etc. Maverick exits. And as the Four Men bring out money -- More AD LIBS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 Maverick in his room. He has finished packing and draws a card from a deck on the dresser. The 8 of Clubs. He reacts badly to this turn of luck and moves to the bed. His gambling shirt is on his bed. He picks it up gently, takes the tissue off.

dialogues.speaker: SHIRT
dialogues.text: Except... she's shrunk the shit out of it. He goes to the balcony and sees the stage heading for the ferry and Annabelle with several men carrying her bags running after her. He yells and she waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 The Main Street as Maverick explodes out the door. He wears the shrunken shirt and carries his belongings. 28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end of the street. The stage is on the ferry. Annabelle is standing nearby. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: watching as Maverick reaches her. This goes snappily.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You did this on purpose!

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You bet I did.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: This was my lucky shirt.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Learn how to do your own laundry.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (spinning her around, holding her shoulders) My underwear comes from New York, where the hell you think that shirt was made? Paris, France, lady -- you think they sell them in the dry goods store?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Why don't you try the kiddies' department --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick grabs for Annabelle and she grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now comes a new male voice, deep and powerful.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Remove your hands from the lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maverick turns -JUST AN INCREDIBLE-LOOKING MAN -- we'll find out soon enough his name is ZANE COOPER. He is raw-boned, blue-eyed, muscle and sinew; rugged as they come. There is also something about him we don't know yet but we will: Coop is so good, so fucking honorable, he seems like someone out of another era --- w hero who dominated movies for most of this century. In other words, we are looking at John Wayne or Gary Cooper. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 Not only has he never done anything bad, the thought of doing anything bad has never crossed his mind.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (very thick Southern; as Maverick takes his hands from her shoulders) Sometimes when you least expect it, a hero arrives. (as Coop is embarrassed) Mister...

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Zane Cooper. Folks call me 'Coop' which suits me just fine.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (as Coop ticks him off on general principles) Coop.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (indicating Maverick) This silly-looking creature is named Maverick. (a step closer to Coop) And I'm Annabelle Bransford. I'm taking this stage.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (his hat has been off since she began speaking to him) So am I.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Death.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: So am I. (beat) Oh, this is just gonna be a helluva lot of fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 28

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (a glance at Maverick) I don't know what this ruffian would have done to me if it had just been the two of us alone on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I hope you can relax and enjoy the journey now. (helps Annabelle into coach) Here's my feeling -- if there wern't any women, we wouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What kind of sense does that make? If there weren't any men, we wouldn't be here either.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: He studies Maverick a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then -- very flat --

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Are you mocking me?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Before I answer, does it bother you?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I can get ruffled.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: We don't want you ruffled. Why don't we just say I was agreeing with you in a totally unusual way. As they study each other -- Annabelle leans out of the coach.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (a smile to Coop, her deepest Southern drawl) What would the world be without true gentlemen like yourself? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 A corpse walks up. Obviously, not an actual corpse, just the most SICKLY-LOOKING MAN you ever saw. He heads for the stage. Maverick opens the door for him.

dialogues.speaker: SICKLY-LOOKING MAN
dialogues.text: (pointing up to the front) I'm the driver.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: SICKLY-LOOKING MAN
dialogues.text: Why are people always asking me that? (holding out a shaky hand) Help me up, son, or we'll never get a move on. Maverick jumps nimbly up to the seat, starts to pull the driver up -- it isn't easy, but the old guy gets there. Maverick and the Driver AD LIB about getting up on stage.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: in his seat now, the reins in his hands. gets down. Maverick 29

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 The stage, on the ferry, moves down the river away from Crystal River. HOLD briefly, then -31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 A deck of cards. with one hand. It is being manipulated dazzlingly Then the deck is put in the other hand. is just as skilled. The manipulation Outside, the water flows by as the ferry moves ahead. Annabelle gets out of the stage and moves to Maverick and Coop. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 32 34.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I think it's time we got to know each other. Mister Maverick here has aspirations toward someday being a card player.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: standing. cards. Makes no reply. Just continues with the

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I'm not totally ignorant of cards. Can't be in my line of work.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: And pray what might that be?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Lawman.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (looking up at him, in awe) I'll bet you're the best there is. I can tell things about a man.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I can't quite place your accent, Mrs. Bransford. What part of the South you from?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Ever been to Mobile?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Well, I'm from Mobile.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Oh, you mean Mobile, Alabama -- I been there -- betcha we know lots of the same people, you start. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 32

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (suddenly near tears; buries her head in Coop's shoulder) I've tried so hard to forget that place -(now she looks up longingly at him) -- I endured such personal tragedy there. Maverick claps his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Bravo.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: A woman's suffering's not a funny thing. (beat) Bertie.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: There are exceptions. Watch your billfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coop and Maverick stare at one another. You get the feeling they're not going off on vacations together. HOLD. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 35 Ramp splashes down into river.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Timberrr... The horses splash into water and up the banks -- pulling hard on the stagecoach as it moves down the valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stagecoach moves down the road past majestic rock formations.

dialogues.speaker: 35A
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 36 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 Annabelle has been flirting, drawing Coop out in conversa cards, can't help but listen.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (gasping -- caught up in the story) But how could you face them down? Nine men, all of them armed.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (might be his credo) A man gives his word to do his job, he's honor bound to do it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: But you must have been afraid.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: A mite.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Mr. Maverick doesn't believe in bravery.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Now, Mrs. Bransford, all I said was I think it's overrated, and it doesn't suit me.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: He smiles. He has, by the way, a wonderful smile.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I just realized something.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: You're spineless. I hope so. this long.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: It's kept me alive

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Where would the world be if everybody was like you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 36 37.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: World would be okay -- have a lot more poker tables, a lot less violence. When I went to war, my pappy said, 'Son, if you come back with a medal, I'll kill you with my bare hands.' (beat) Brought me up to be obedient.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You were in the war, Mr. Maverick?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: playing with the cards, staring out.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: No, I was captured early, prisoner for awhile, came out here and scouted, brought in Geronimo once, hell of a poker player. Helped him get free once, he did belong free.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He was a wonderful poker player.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I don't believe anything you say.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK AND COOP
dialogues.text: (looks at her -quietly) Neither do I...

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Thank you for the hanky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maverick stares out again -36A

dialogues.speaker: 36A
dialogues.text: The Angel, in a foul mood, walking into the dimly lit saloon. It's morning. He goes to the bar. The four Bad Guys from the night before are laughing and eating breakfast -- eggs and coffee. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FOUR COWBOYS
dialogues.text: Maverick clobbered in the fight. They are down the bar from The Angel. And they are the ones laughing. Clearly, at him. As they whisper and their laughter builds -THE AN He takes his second drink which is now poured, drops it down the hatch, and walks over to the Cowboys.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: (dead sober) One question -- are you, by any chance, laughing at me?

dialogues.speaker: LEAD COWBOY
dialogues.text: Heavens to Betsy, no. Now they all four laugh again.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: I want to know the joke.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD COWBOY
dialogues.text: You, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Explain that!

dialogues.speaker: LEAD COWBOY
dialogues.text: Not unless you pay us one helluva lot more than Maverick did. And on that bit of information -CLOSEUP - THE ANGEL He's not taking this well.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: (hard to talk) He paid you to fall down.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR LARGE GUYS
dialogues.text: nodding.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD GUY
dialogues.text: Paid us good too. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: as he slowly rips off a piece of the bar and starts swinging it, catching them off guard -- it goes like a streak this next --- but what he does is cream each of th fall to the floor -THE ANGEL (not even breathing hard) I'll let you fall down for free. (he looks down at the stunned quartet) Maverick was mine anyway... (beat) ... 'cept now it's personal... HOLD ON The Angel. 37 Now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the stage. It's next afternoon. 37 Both men doze.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (shaking them -- a bit alarmed) Do you think he's found a shortcut? 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 38 Clearly, the coach is out of control as it is flying down the road. They are going like hell across very rough country. rocking inside is bad and getting worse as we -39 The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 Maverick and Coop, both sticking their heads out the window, shouting at the driver. 40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver. Slumped in his seat. 40 Limp. Eyes closed.  40. 41

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the coach. 41 Coop is getting ready for action.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (to Maverick) Go on up there and stop the stage -MAVERICK -- I'm not sure I want to do that -COOP -- the wheel is coming loose! -if it falls off, we're all dead -- I'll climb out and secure it, you handle the driver -- let's go -MAVERICK He nods, reaches out for the nearest door, shoves it open and -42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 42 Maverick, moving out the door -- and this is the beginnin

dialogues.speaker: TERRAIN
dialogues.text: flying by. Bumpy and dusty and

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: holding on to the side of the stage. It's not a matter here of him falling off -- he's too powerful and athletic for that -- but he's blinded by the dust and is trying like hell to get his bearings. Plus, this is not anyone's idea of comfort.

dialogues.speaker: TERRAIN
dialogues.text: A huge rut -MAVERICK flying half off the stage, managing to hold on, pull hims

dialogues.speaker: RAILING
dialogues.text: around the roof as he grabs hold, first with one hand, then with the other and -(CONTINUED)  41. 42

dialogues.speaker: HORSES
dialogues.text: pounding along -- as they hit another huge rut -MAVERICK being flipped up and onto the roof, where he lands hard, but still manages to keep hold of the railing.

dialogues.speaker: 42A
dialogues.text: Coop sits as calmly and comfortably as possible, listenin Annabelle is confused, and just a bit frightened.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You said we'd die if the wheel came off.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Rest easy, Miss Annabelle, wheel is just fine.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (it's getting scarier -- she reaches for him) For protection, you don't mind?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (shyly) Proud as a peacock.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (glancing up as more sounds come from the roof) You don't think he'll kill you?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (nah) In the long run, the lad will thank me in his prayers. As he continues to hold the frightened Annabelle -42B

dialogues.speaker: 42B
dialogues.text: The terrain is getting bumpier -(CONTINUED)  42.

dialogues.speaker: 42B
dialogues.text: -- and this is where it starts to get tricky -- he inches forward across the luggage toward where the driver is --- several feet below and getting down has to be timed just right because if you hit a bump when you're trying to get off the roof -- not a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: He lies sprawled and motionless on the seat. The reins are still in his hands -- but loose -- he has no control over the animals.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: getting ready to lower himself down and -HORSES picking up speed and -TERRAIN flashing by and -MAVERICK making his move and -GIGANTIC RUT and -MAVERICK thrown wildly off balance as he tries to get to the driver's seat and as he is about to fall off the entire rampaging stage -42C

dialogues.speaker: 42C
dialogues.text: Coop, peering out the window toward the front where Maverick is. He starts to chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (going back to Annabelle, a sweet memory) How well I remember my first runaway stage -(MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Annabelle) There's a knack to doing it. (as she sits alongside him now) More protection? (as she nods) Thought so. As she holds him tight -43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 43 Maverick, managing to grab the driver, who doesn't look any worse than when we first met him except now he is dead. Plus, being dead, he's not grabbing hold of anythin sliding along the seat and -MAVERICK off the stage now and getting, he realizes, very close to shit creek --- he makes a desperate lunge, just manages t of the railing that circles the driver's seat as we -DEAD sliding along, still holding the reins, his body coming closer and closer to Maverick and -MAVERICK letting go of the dead driver, grabbing the rail with both hands, forcing himself up to the seat just as the dead driver starts to fall off it --- but not before Mave so now they're both on the driver's seat, Maverick reachi around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: doing his best to ignore the corpse and take control of the reins --- which at last, thank God, he does --- and l reins, one in each of his powerful hands -(CONTINUED)  44. 43

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (roaring) Just whoa, goddamit! And as soon as he utters his mighty command -HORSES as they start to go faster --- they are zooming along now the seat, catapulting him forward and -43A

dialogues.speaker: 43A
dialogues.text: Coop and Annabelle, getting bounced all the hell around.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You don't think it might be nice to go out there and help him?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I could do that, absolutely -- but after he's worked so hard, he might resent it. Something tells me that inside that buffoon, there's a real human being trying to get out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You think it's possible.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: God moves in mysterious ways...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From them -43B

dialogues.speaker: 43B
dialogues.text: The corpse, lying on the seat, bumping up and down and -M steaming mad now -- he takes the reins again, really pulls on them with everything he's got. This time he shouts -MAVERICK Timberrr!

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Stunned -- my God, it worked.  45. 44

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 The horses, at last slowing and, exhausted, as they come to a halt -45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 Stopped. Maverick, wiped out, taking a deep breath as he sits for a moment on the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: COOP AND ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: getting out of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: still bleary from what he's been through. attention, he jumps to the ground -- Without paying -- which is a mistake --- he should have been paying atte three thousand-foot cliff.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: landing, losing his balance --- the cliff is very sheer - trying to get balance as we -COOP AND ANNABELLE She is horrified by what could happen. Coop moves quickly forward -- he's close enough to reach out a hand to Maverick --- only he doesn't. as we -- He just stands there, idly watching

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: and he is not a happy camper -CLIFF DROP Horrendous.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: curious as to just what's going to happen. distraught, puts her hands over her eyes. Annabelle, (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: windmilling in desperation -- and for a moment it looks like he's not going to make it --- but finally he does, p ground.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (now he extends a hand) Let me help you.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (glaring up) You've done too much already. He gets to his feet. the stage. Still out of breath, he looks at

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What's with the wheel?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Turns out I was wrong -- wheel was fine all along.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: He was doing you a favor -- don't you feel a whole lot better about yourself now that you've done something brave?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: There is a pause. Then, smiling amiably back at Coop --

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Oh, I get it, this was for my benefit. To help me. Build character.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Funny, you'd think I'd be mad.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Look at him -- bursting with pride.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: One thing though? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 Coop looks at him -- as Maverick does his lightning draw, cocks his pistol, aims it at Coop's head -- he could almost shoot.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Try not to help me again! From that -46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46 A freshly covered-over grave. Maverick and Coop are cover them. It's later in the afternoon now.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I suppose somebody ought to say something nice about the deceased.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: How do we know he was nice? We don't know anything about him. All he had in his wallet was the names of some whorehouses. And now, O.S., the sound Maverick's voice in song -MAVERI who has started into "Amazing Grace" --- and the shocker A strong, firm voice echoing out over the rough land.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: 'Amazing Grace How sweet the sound...' -- and now, surprisingly, Coop joins in. And here's something else you didn't expect: He can sing too.

dialogues.speaker: COOP/MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (in harmony) '... that saved a wretch like me...' (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 46 48.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 46 And now Annabelle, touched by what's happening, joins them, her voice high and lovely.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE/COOP/MAVERICK
dialogues.text: '... I once was lost But now I'm found...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, as they come to the end of the first verse, Annabelle sings different words from the men. She realizes her mistake, stops, and listens to them.

dialogues.speaker: COOP/MAVERICK
dialogues.text: '... was bound...'

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: '... was blind...' Here she stops, lets them sing in harmony the last line.

dialogues.speaker: COOP/MAVERICK
dialogues.text: '... but now I'm free...'

dialogues.speaker: COOP/MAVERICK/ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: 'Twas grace that taught my heart to fear, And grace my fears relieved, How precious did that grace appear, The hour I first believed...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Through many dangers, toils and snares, I have already come. Tis Grace hath brought me safe thus far. And Grace will lead me home.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all stand close together as the ECHO OF the SONG DIES. Then -*

dialogues.speaker: 46A
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS ALONG telegraph wires TO a small telegraph office.

dialogues.speaker: 46B
dialogues.text: reaches across counter and accepts a telegram.

dialogues.speaker: TELEGRAM
dialogues.text: It reads: "Don't let him (Maverick) reach St. Louis (the game)." 47 thru 49

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 thru 49  MAVERICK - Rev. 8/31/93 50 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 The stagecoach, moving along as before, when --- there is Just the most pathetic sight. Filled with widows and children in tears. Several wounded men. Two of the wagons are smoldering and burned. Coop vaults to the ground, hurries to the wagons as Maverick brings the stagecoach to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: is talking with several women from the wagon train.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK AND ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: on the coach, watching. Annabelle silently gets out a flask, takes a pull of whisky, offers some to Maverick. He shakes his head. She shrugs, takes another pull, puts the flask away.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: returning to the stage with a RAWBONED WOMAN and a PIONEER WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: They got hit by Indians -RAWBONED WOMAN (a little hysterical) It was horrible. Those Indians snuck up behind us, and... and...

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: It wasn't Indians.

dialogues.speaker: RAWBONED WOMAN
dialogues.text: They were in war paint and screamin' and yellin'...

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I told 'em we'd take 'em back to Crystal City... Annabelle and the two Women discuss aside the details of the attack; meanwhile Maverick and Coop: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 8/31/93 50 50.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (overlapping and under his breath) Uh -- that's backtrackin' a little, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Just a day. Maverick rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (sotto) Look, I really got a poker game...

dialogues.speaker: RAWBONED WOMAN
dialogues.text: (starting to cry) ... and they wounded our men and they burned our wagons...

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (sotto) Uh, Coop...

dialogues.speaker: RAWBONED WOMAN
dialogues.text: (continuing the description) ... And they shot our horses and they took the wagon with all of our money...

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (turning) Money?

dialogues.speaker: RAWBONED WOMAN
dialogues.text: (sobbing) ... and my baby's music box -OTHER WOMAN They even took my wedding dress.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (beat) Go back to the money part. The Woman continues to wail.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Jesus, Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (mock understanding) Ma'am, how much money exactly? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 8/31/93 50

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Jesus, Maverick. Annabelle cuts in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (dripping with understanding) Ma'am, how much money exactly?

dialogues.speaker: BOTH WOMEN
dialogues.text: (sniffling in unison) Thirty thousand dollars. There is dead silence for a beat before Maverick and Annabelle climb right in her face, yammering simultaneous

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Ma'am, if I can get your thirty thousand dollars back, is it worth ten percent to you?

dialogues.speaker: RAWBONED WOMAN
dialogues.text: Five percent?

dialogues.speaker: OTHER WOMAN
dialogues.text: (sniffling) Whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Jesus, what kind of animal are you?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Vulture!

dialogues.speaker: RAWBONED WOMAN
dialogues.text: You think you could?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (confident) Well, ma'am, I think that -ANNABELLE You bet we could! Maverick looks over at her and says...

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What's this 'we' shit? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 8/31/93 50

dialogues.speaker: RAWGONED WOMAN
dialogues.text: For your ten percent, I want you to make those savages pay for what they done!

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Ma'am, there are no hostiles in this area. Suddenly they are enveloped in booming sounds which are instantly recognizable as Indian WAR DRUMS.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 51 thru

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: 51 thru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56 Maverick sneaks through the brush with Annabelle at his side. Coop follows a step or two behind leading the horses. He keeps his eyes pealed as they track.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: These ponies have been shod. Indians don't shoe their horses.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: They could have been stolen. What's with you and Indians anyway?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're right. They're just a bunch of theives and savages. Don't get me wrong. I mean we've given them smallpox blankets. I figure they deserved it for being on our land before we got here. What are you doing here anyway?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I'm your partner. Fifty-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (nobly) Sounds like fifty-fifty to me.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: And what are you tagging along for? You want fifty percent too? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 8/31/93 56 52A.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I just want to see those fine ladies get their money back. Maverick grumbles to himself and ducks under a low branch. Annabelle pushes it aside, snapping it back into Coop's face. He blinks a couple of times then moves stoically forward.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (turning to Annabelle) I don't split my bounty with anybody.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Well, I suppose sixty/forty would be acceptable if you're going to be recalcitrant... Maverick and Coop do a double take on this.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: 'Re' -- what?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (with condescention) Education.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (dumbfounded) Sixty/forty! What are you gonna do for forty percent?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (lady-like) I'm going to help. At that moment Annabelle loses her footing on the trail and lurches forward. She grabs onto Maverick, clutching onto his gunbelt, as she tries to keep her balance. Annabelle FIRES ONE ROUND into the ground (with his gun still in his holster). Maverick turns and looks at her in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Seventy/thirty?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (getting nuts) Excuse me, but you're not exactly an experienced tracker! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 8/31/93 56

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Big tracker! Follow a couple of horse tracks. Anyone could do that. You're not so great.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (turning) You see that hawk over there?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You know what it means when it?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: ... What?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Absolutely nothing. But you didn't know that did you?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (beat) I did so.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You did not.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (breaking it up) Children... They turn and look at him for a beat. back at Maverick. Annabelle glances

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (quickly turning away) Shh... Maverick quickly drops to the ground, putting his head down to the earth, listening.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Oh right! Lemme guess. You smell a bunch of Indians off in Montana... Beat, hooked. No.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (concentrating hard now) Not Indians. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 8/31/93 56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56 Maverick rolls over to his back still listening, halfway

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (really hooked now) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (pulling his hat over his eyes) Just gonna take a nap here 'til the sun goes down. We'll sneak up on them at dark. Annabelle fumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57 Above the treetops -- FOLLOW a hawk soaring across the sky; as we PAN we reveal Maverick, on his haunches again, studying, studying.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND
dialogues.text: That's all it is, just dirt.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: still watching it. Then he rises, whistles for his horse, gracefully mounts. And rides very slowly forward. If it isn't clear by now, it should be: lowing something. Maverick's fol- Who knows? Maybe he was an Indian Scout after all. In any case, this much is clear: the man has instincts other people don't have. 58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick, riding along, watching the terrain. The sound of a WATERFALL GETS LOUDER as he approaches it. -- he stops --- listens --- no question, he's hearing som MUSIC. He urges his horse forward, very slowly. 58  MAVERICK - Rev. 8/31/93

dialogues.speaker: 58A
dialogues.text: The terrain they're going over. Rocky again. The HORSE'S HOOVES make sounds. Over the RUSH of the WATERFAL He quickly reins in, dismounts, moves a few steps away, studying. Then he gives an all but inaudible WHISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: HIS HORSE
dialogues.text: It obeys immediately, trots to him, stops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He ties the horse to a small tree, puts his fingers to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (as if the horse were human) Shhhh -- and stay that way.

dialogues.speaker: HORSE
dialogues.text: It nods as if it understands.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (pats his horse's head, whispers) Ollie, if you're smarter than I am, keep it to yourself.

dialogues.speaker: HORSE
dialogues.text: It nods again.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: moving slowly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 Maverick, moving slowly forward. He might be a shadow too -- he makes no sound. IS GROWING LOUDER. The MUSIC

dialogues.speaker: HIS SHADOW
dialogues.text: He moves silently forward. Slowly, without any sound -- -- then he freezes.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Staring ahead. Now -* 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 Across a pond -- a campfire. Half a dozen men. They are all six of them white. And several still have paint on their faces and bodies. A couple of them wash their faces in the pond. Others dance to an old-time music box. All of them are drinking. HOLD then --  54. 61

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick comes riding up. 61 Then --

dialogues.speaker: COOP, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Bring it to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: He lies against a rock. Annabelle lies close alongside. Maverick dismounts, moves to them.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Found 'em. Six men. Snow white. Some of them still had paint on. (as Coop looks dubious) Come with me -- it's not that long a ride, now that I know where they are. I need someone to vouch for what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What's with you and Indians?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Not a thing. Personally I think we've spoiled them from the beginning. We've poisoned them, infected them, killed them -- but I say it's their fault for being on our land before we got here.

dialogues.speaker: ALL THREE
dialogues.text: Annabelle nods.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Let's go -- these guys were drinking heavy, they're not up to anything tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (rising along with Coop) This could be exciting.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Could be dangerous, too.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: staring up at Coop. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Couldn't be as dangerous as being a married woman and standing next to the most blindingly-attractive man on the face of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: His back has been to her but it's clear to him she's talking about him. He turns --- oops --- she's looking at Coop and that's wh to. Maverick, embarrassed, turns away. 62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62 The three of them riding in silence. Still dusk. As they go across a small but fast stream, both Maverick and Coop lead her horse along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63 Their horses are tied up in the same place as Maverick tied his before. In the distance now, the sound of the MUSIC BOX.

dialogues.speaker: THREE OF THEM
dialogues.text: moving in silence. The MUSIC BOX is LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (soft) Could you teach me to be a great poker player?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (stunned) Now?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Well, you could be dead tomorrow and I need help. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I couldn't make you great if I lived to be even as old as Coop, but anyone can make you better. (as Coop glares at him) Poker's about bluffing and when you bluff, you've got two dead giveaways -- first one is you touch your thumb to your little finger. The other thing is -COOP (very flat) Shut up. Shut up. 64 Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 64 The three walking in dead silence.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: as her boot brushes a small stone, sending it skittering.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK AND COOP
dialogues.text: Both of them whirling, glaring at her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: She mouths "Sorry." Now -- They move on in silence again. 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 The six men we saw before. Under blankets, some snoring, some not. Whiskey bottles on the ground. Their six horses tied nearby. There is the remains of a fire. It's not as high as it was, but it's still burning, giving off, along with the moon, the only light. PULL BACK to reveal -Maverick, Coop and Annabelle, on the Maverick and Coop have pulled back bushes, giving them room to see. This next is whispered and fast. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66 57.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: There they are. It's gotta be them.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: It could be just a bunch of drunken cowboys fooling around.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Look at the warpaint... dressed up like Indians.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Proof is identification, right? What you got now is nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Nothing? What proof do you need? The music box, your sweetheart's wedding dress. Mary Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Margaret Mary. And what do you mean sweetheart? She's not my sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: First name basis... I figured...

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Quiet... Now, do you see any money?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He's probably got it stashed in someplace unsavory.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: They're right. He glances at the six men.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (to Coop) We can bring 'em in easy, we can surprise them.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: What's this strange new word that's entered your vocabulary? -'we'? -- this is your sh percent, remember? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (stunned) You'd let me face down six men?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I've only got one gun. That's only six bullets. They have six guns, so that's thirty-six bullets and they probably have two each so that's seventy-two bullets, so -and rifles...

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Shut up. Do you realize you're babbling?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (her voice louder than before) You are babbling. Don't worry -they're probably drunk and brought in nine dead sober.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Coop's always dead sober -COOP -- She didn't mean that -MAVERICK -- She said that -ANNABELLE (louder) -- The outlaws were dead sober -The last three lines are

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK AND COOP
dialogues.text: Both of them clapping a hand on her mouth as we...

dialogues.speaker: SIX MEN
dialogues.text: One of them has heard something -- he goes up on one elbow, looks around. He reaches under his blanket for a moment, brings it back out -- he holds a gun. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: GUY WITH GUN
dialogues.text: He stands -- he's wearing long underwear -- stares around.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK AND COOP AND ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: No one moves.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Still don't see any money.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
