dialogues.text: Coop, if he can cook, he looks better than Mary Margaret in that wedding dress. Even prettier.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Margaret Mary and shut up.

dialogues.speaker: GUY WITH GUN
dialogues.text: He takes a step in their direction, then another, another -ANNABELLE whose eyes are widening. Then --

dialogues.speaker: GUY WITH GUN
dialogues.text: suddenly stopping, reaching down, grabbing a whisky bottl which is what he was after all the time, drinking from it as he returns to his blanket, gets under it. He drinks a little more, eyes closed, then puts the bottle down.

dialogues.speaker: THREE
dialogues.text: Whispering soft again.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (to Coop) What if there's trouble?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I'll be right behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, right behind me. And none of this 'wheel is coming off' shit?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (great lawman now) That was about broken bones -- this is about dying.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You better give me yours. (moves to Annabelle) I know you got one. Hand it over. Dying?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I'm a lady. No, you can't have it. Okay... Okay... Fifty-fifty. No.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Sixty-forty.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Fifty-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Sixty-forty.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Fifty-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Seventy-thirty.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Sixty-forty.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Okay. Sixty-forty. But it's just a little bitty thing and you're the fastest anyone's seen. What do you want my gun for?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Who says he's the fastest?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: He says he is.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I admit it, I am fast. But I also can't hit shit. When they're real people I'm aiming at. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I never know whether to believe you.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Neither do I.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: ... Bert...

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Bret. My name is Bret. You're Annabelle. He's Coop. I'm Bret. Bret.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You too. Of course. He heads off. Annabelle and Coop reposition and look...

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK AND CAMPFIRE
dialogues.text: sauntering toward them alone, his gun in his holster.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Hi... Hello, everybody. I saw your campfire and thought I'd visit. I'm Burt... uh, Bret Maverick. He makes a nice smile.

dialogues.speaker: SIX GUYS
dialogues.text: staring around at each other. What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He moves closer, stops. Just the flickering fire light with help from the moon. The terrain is flat, dusty.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You're probably wondering why I'm here and it's just to give you one little piece of information -(MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) -- right now, right at this very second -(beat -- quietly) -- guns are aimed at each and every one of your pretty little heads.

dialogues.speaker: SIX GUYS
dialogues.text: blinking. They've all had too much to drink, sure, but this is news you don't forget in a hurry. Now they stare at the area around them.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Going on calmly, without a care in the world.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Now, you've got a perfect right to know who's out there and why.

dialogues.speaker: COOP AND ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: crouched, hidden, watching. Coop misses nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: pointing to the nearest of the six.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: The man who'll blow your brains out is Marshal Zane Cooper. I know what you're thinkin'. I know he's old and decrepit and he guns his food and his women. But he can still shoot straight. (to the next guy) Johnny Hardin's out for you. You probably know him, unbeaten as a gunfighter. And he's not dead, but he hangs out with dead people.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GUY
dialogues.text: The start of genuine fear among the six.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: breath held, watching as before. anything. Coop is ready for (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (to third guy) You belong to Ugly Annie Bransford -- clocks have been known to beg for mercy when Ugly Annie comes near -- She's so ugly her mother had to hang pork chops around her so the dog would play with her. She's so ugly that when she's making love she has to pretend she's someone else... Annabelle is steaming.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (whispered) Admit it, that was funny.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I didn't think it was funny.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: chatting amiably on.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Whistle... come on... what... another wheel off? Okay... clap. Why this fuss? 'Cause some Indians killed some whites attacking a wagon train. I believe that, but some of the women, you know how hysterical they can get, think it might have been whites masquerading. Silliest thing I ever heard of. Besides, no fool of a woman could recognize a man in war paint on horseback anyway. So all this is going to cost you is a few hours of beauty sleep.

dialogues.speaker: THE SIX
dialogues.text: scared worse than before; scared of all kinds of things now. He's getting them, no question.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Convincing as hell.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: The reason I'm the one out here is, well, some people think I can talk pretty good -- not that I'm exactly helpless with a gun -(CONTINUED)  MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: -- and again he does what we saw back in the saloon -the

dialogues.speaker: SIX MEN
dialogues.text: Their fear is palpable.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Watching. trouble. Transfixed. Coop's eyes scan for possible

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: expertly spinning the gun back into its holster.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Taut, sensitive to every nuance, every possible danger.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He's got them and he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: So all you've got to do is stand up and put your hands on top of your heads. Here's a man using his head.

dialogues.speaker: SIX
dialogues.text: A hesitation. Then --

dialogues.speaker: NEAREST GUY
dialogues.text: He scrambles to his feet, puts his hands on his head.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GUY
dialogues.text: He scrambles up too, his fingers locking together on the top of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third guy, jumping up --- but with a gun in his hand and -The shooting begins. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: COOP WITH ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: -- and Coop hasn't moved at all. the SOUND OF GUNFIRE begins -- Just stands there as

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Aren't you going out there?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (aghast) A man could get killed doing that. Now, from them -MAVERICK -- only he isn't there --- because from here on until it' movement, and we've known he could draw and we've known he could play cards but we didn't know 'til now how quick he was --- plus one more thing --- every time he FIRES, h he was, and he comes out of the dive into a roll, and as he comes up out of the roll FIRING -FOURTH GUY the one on his knees, as Maverick's BULLET hits his forearm and he screams, drops the gun, scrambles after it with his good hand and -MAVERICK risking one more shot and he squeezes it off, goes into a sideways roll as we -THIRD GUY the one who began the firing, as Maverick's SHOT crushes his shoulder and he screams too, but the pain has him and he drops his gun and falls and -COOP as a bullet hits the tree... watching the action unfold, not a muscle moving, and -(CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: FIFTH AND SIXTH GUYS
dialogues.text: BLASTING away and -MAVERICK the roll over but still on the ground as he FIRES OFF TWO SHOTS and as he starts to get to his feet -FIFTH AND one hit on the hand, the other on the knee, and the knee guy is done, crying out in pain but the hand guy, it isn't over for him and -FIRST AND SECOND GUYS the ones with their hands on the tops of their heads and by now they've managed to drop to earth, reach around, find their weapons and -MAVERICK diving again, rolling up --- but this time he doesn't fir second dive, and we hadn't expected it and neither did anybody else as -FIRST AND SECOND GUYS doing their best to shift their aim and -MAVERICK coming up to one knee, concentrating on the first guy and -SECOND GUY moving away and for just a moment he's got Maverick dead in his sights and -MAVERICK BLASTING the first guy, hitting him in the thigh and as he starts to fold -SECOND GUY about to squeeze off a deadly shot when we -(CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: terrified and then something amazing happens --- Coop dra too, and TWO SHOTS come almost at once and -SECOND GUY as the first shot from Coop takes the gun from his hand, the next SHOT crunches into his shoulder and he cries out, begins to spin to earth and -COOP the gun already back in its holster -ANNABELLE did she just see what she thought she saw? Coop just stares out as before as if nothing had taken place.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: looking at the second guy -- watching him hit the ground and for just a moment he's not quite sure what happened but there isn't time to think as we -FOURTH GUY who was hit in the forearm and now he's got his gun in the other hand and as he does his best to aim -MAVERICK FIRING another perfect SHOT --- ooops --- his GUN makes a (cursing himself) Learn to count, asshole -And as he drops his pistol, reac Annabelle's -COOP watching idly, Annabelle alongside.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: The lad definitely has potential -(CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (really isn't sure) -- did you just help him? -COOP (shakes his head) -- it's his show.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: studying Coop a brief moment, as we -ANNABELLE'S PISTOL in Maverick's hand now --- it really is small --- and now comes up with the tiny pistol almost disappearing in his hand and -FOURTH GUY FIRING, but wild and -MAVERICK FIRING --- dead solid perfect --- he's nailed him in the out, drops the gun -MAVERICK staring at the little gun -MAVERICK (to himself) Damn thing actually works -FIFTH GUY who was shot in the hand and he's trying to use both his hands now but no chance as we -MAVERICK spinning, FIRING, ONE, TWO, THREE times and -(CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 66

dialogues.speaker: FIFTH GUY
dialogues.text: and he's hit in the hand, the leg, the knee and as he screams and falls -MAVERICK The only one standing. guys writhe -- All around him now, the six -- and the SOUND OF GUNFIRE, which was so deafening just a minute ago, well, that's gone...

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Exhausted by what he's just been through. 67

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 67 Annabelle and Coop see what's happened and they cross over to Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You're wonderful. You're wonderful. Isn't it exciting. Six men. We had to wait so long. Coop joins Maverick and Annabelle runs around and questions each Bad Guy about where the money is.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: You know what you did wrong? You shot the guy in the front and you should have shot the guy in the back.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What do you mean? I shot the right guy. How do you know? Annabelle has found the box of money and is delighted. She is touching, counting and just enjoying this cash.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (to Danny) Take that dress off!

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: How dare you.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Not you... him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 67 69A.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Get your claws off. They cross to her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I found it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I worked hard for it.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I'll take the money.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I'll count it. They head off.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (to Maverick) Where are you going? up this mess. You clean Annabelle and Coop move off. The Bad Guys have realized that they're ignored and they crawl, trying to escape. Maverick finally notices.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (to Coop) Watch her. (to guys) Keep back. Line up. Put your guns in the middle. (the b.g.) Don't let her near you. She sold Mr. Bransford. She'd steal the cheese out of the rat trap and not get caught. He keeps babbling.

dialogues.speaker: COOP, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You're babbling.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: No, I'm not babbling. I'm not! He leads the guys out and, of course, continues babbling.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: 68  MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 69 69B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 It is morning and the six bad guys from the campfire are tied up to wheels, wagons and each other. Maverick is building a fire for cooking for himself and Coop and Annabelle. Annabelle comes over.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You the chef?

dialogues.speaker: MARGARET MARY
dialogues.text: Bless you for finding my wedding dress. Now I can get married.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I know it will look lovely.

dialogues.speaker: MARGARET MARY
dialogues.text: The Lord says it is good for men and women to dwell together in unity.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I know that when you reach your final destination someone will be waiting for you. God will take care of you. Mary Margaret is counting money. watch. Two Two Two Two thousand thousand thousand thousand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabelle and Maverick

dialogues.speaker: MARY MARGARET
dialogues.text: four hundred dollars. five hundred dollars. six hundred dollars. eight hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Two thousand seven hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: MARY MARGARET
dialogues.text: Are you sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: She'd know.

dialogues.speaker: MARY MARGARET
dialogues.text: Two thousand seven hundred... eight hundred... nine hundred... Three thousand dollars. Here you go Mr. Maverick. Ten percent that we promised. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 69 69C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 She hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: MARY MARGARET
dialogues.text: That leaves us with twenty-seven thousand dollars, Margaret Mary.

dialogues.speaker: MARGARET MARY
dialogues.text: That's not enough for a mission, Mary Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: MARY MARGARET
dialogues.text: Don't you worry. The Lord will provide.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Well, you know, Ma'am, my Pappy always said, 'Never sneeze when you hide. Never smile when you lie, and never, ever take money from ladies who've lost a dog and a wedding dress and whose wagon burned. He hands back the money. just thrilled. They whoop and yell and are Maverick takes off with Annabelle and Coop following.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I had a wedding dress once.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: But she got hers back.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: We had a deal. You owe me thirty percent.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Okay, here's thirty percent of what I got. (hands her nothing; she spits) Here, take it all.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Children... I hate to interrupt, but I got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 69

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Well, if these renegades aren't the real Indians, who was beating those drums?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (looks up) Maybe it was them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 And maybe fifty Indians, maybe more. All mounted and armed. There are more on the other side of the stream. All in war paint.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: getting to his feet. Carefully. Coop makes no move.

dialogues.speaker: WOMEN AND KIDS
dialogues.text: frozen.

dialogues.speaker: SIX GUYS MAVERICK FOUGHT
dialogues.text: Handcuffed to one of the wagon trains. Pale with terror.

dialogues.speaker: INDIANS
dialogues.text: A series of blood-curdling cries.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: moving between Maverick and Coop. Neither of them is particularly overjoyed at this moment either.

dialogues.speaker: SKY
dialogues.text: The Indians have the dying light behind them.

dialogues.speaker: ENTIRE TABLEAU
dialogues.text: The wagon train with its helpless wounded and women and children. Maverick and Coop standing on either side of Annabelle. And surrounding them, above them, silent and deadly, the war-painted Indians. For a long moment, no one moves --- then --- the sound of  Indians. A few of them separate, making room -- -- and there he is -72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 The Indian of every white man's nightmares. A massive figure, rippling with brutal power. terrifying cruelty behind his eyes. There is a (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 72 71.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 72 He sits on a magnificent white horse. He wears a long headdress. And war paint that makes him seem, if that's possible, even more frightening. He reins in at the top of the hill, glares down at the intruders.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'll take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTMARE INDIAN
dialogues.text: as suddenly, in a deep, guttural voice, he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTMARE CHIEF
dialogues.text: (his words subtitled) Hello, Bret, you've come for the money I owe you? Maverick, glancing around at the others.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Anybody get all that? No one does.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (to Maverick) You know about Indians, can you speak to him?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'll do my best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he takes a step forward and when he speaks, it's in Indian too. (THROUGHOUT THIS, HE AND JOSEPH, FOR THAT IS

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Joseph, go with me on this -I'll explain later.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (subtitled) How long will it take -- I'm getting hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 72

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (subtitled) I know it's hot, now scream at me.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: letting loose a blood-curdling sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panic among those down below. Coop turns to Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: What's he saying?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (nervous) We've committed a terrible sin -this is sacred ground.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: We didn't know it was sacred -Can't you explain that to h

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'll try my best. (to Joseph; subtitled) Shake your head and fire your rifle in the air -- look really mad -- lots of words.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: doing as told. Even though you know he's obeying orders, it's very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: edging closer to Maverick and Coop.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (nods -- upset) Doesn't make any difference... His gods demand a sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Sacrifice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 72

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (long pause -- then, whispered) Human.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (in English) What the hell am I doing? a bitch. Son of

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (looks around) Anybody catch that? No one seems to.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (up to Joseph in Indian -subtitled) You're doing great -- Point your finger around at everybody and speak angry.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: his long finger taking in everyone down below. comes from his throat. Fury

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (Lots of Indian Ad Libs about Annabelle.)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Really worried now.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: If someone passes the Indian Bravery test, he won't kill the rest of us. (beat) But one of us has to go with him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What's the Indian Bravery Test?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He says he cuts off both hands -if you don't make a sound (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 72

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Both hands?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: up to Joseph.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Hold up one finger and holler some.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: As he does what he's told, he seems like a figure out of myth.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE AND COOP
dialogues.text: staring at Maverick, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: as suddenly he starts laughing and talking.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (subtitled) I never did anything like this before -- it's fun.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: quickly explaining -MAVERICK They're laughing about the pain to come -- he loves to see suffering --

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (glancing up) -- you can tell that just by looking at him -MAVERICK Can't you tell? Blood thirsty savage.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: firing his weapon at the skies again, shrieking louder than ever. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 72

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (up to Joseph, subtitled) -- don't overdo it.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Who's the girl, she's pretty?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Point to her, say you want her.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (subtitled) I do want her, is she available?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Look at her passionately -- scream with lust -JOSEPH doing as he's told -- it's very clear he's hot for her. And other chant "Goldilocks."

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: going bravely to a frightened Annabelle. Indian and then corrects himself. He speaks in

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'll die before I let him touch you -ANNABELLE -- There's too many -- even you can't protect me -MAVERICK -- don't show fear -- it drives them crazy -(to Coop) We've got to end this before it gets bad -- it's got to be one of us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long silence.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: He nods. talk -- Then he starts to (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 72

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I'll go. It's my turn -- I almost got you killed twice already.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I can't do the things you can. Take care of the women and the children. I gotta go with them. But it's okay -- third time lucky.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: staring at Maverick. The bravest words she ever heard have just been spoken.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Bret -MAVERICK (to Joseph -subtitled) One more minute and I'm coming. And on that -COOP leaves to get a horse.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: And it's clear in her eyes -- she doesn't want him to go.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (soft; brave) I liked it just now when you called me Bret. Listen to me now. What?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What, dear Bret?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: When you're going to bluff, don't flick your fingernails against your front teeth. That's the second giveaway you've got to work on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 72

dialogues.speaker: INDIAN
dialogues.text: Is he always this slow?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (coming apart) Even at a moment like this, you're thinking of others.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: You should see him playing cards. Annabelle grabs and kisses Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Goodbye, my lady. Coop has arrived with his horse. horse. Maverick gets on his

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You were right, Coop. I never felt better in my life than I do right now.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: See, now when they cut my hands off, my lucky shirt'll fit again... And he mounts his horse, rides up toward his fate as we -73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 of the entire wagon train watching Maverick go. every one of them desperately moved. HOLD... 75 Each and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Maverick reaches him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (in English now -he speaks well) What was all that?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (at same time) What's with the drums and the war paint?! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (together) Tell you later.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I could die happy right now... Maverick turns back to wagon train, throwing a heroic wave. Everyone rides off in a cloud of dust. 76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 76 Maverick and Joseph near a large teepee. Joseph is clearly the leader of his tribe and his teepee reflects this. Gorgeous skins as rugs, gorgeous feather headdresse Joseph is helping Maverick test a brand new bipedal machine -- a primitive bicycle.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Gotta pedal... gotta pedal.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Where did you get this piece of junk?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: I won it off a Russian in a card game.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I think I prefer horses. Maverick falls.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What are you laughing at?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: It's never been ridden before.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: It's so beautiful here. do pick the spots. You sure

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (nods) Too beautiful -- next time when you people drive us out, I'm going to find a nice piece of swampland -something so awful you'll the hell alone. They AD LIB as they head for the teepees. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 77 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 Joseph walks to Maverick at the fire with a bowl of food.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: That good?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Don't whistle. The WAR DRUMS start.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Why the drums? And the warpaint? The horses?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: We had a rotten harvest so when this Russian Archduke came along ... That's where I got the bike... He wanted to see the 'real West' -(shrugs) -- I said okay. He pays well. We go whooping around in warpaint like idiots and beat those stupid drums. It's getting on my nerves. (shakes his head) He likes me to speak like we're supposed to in books. (the cliche Indian now) 'How, white man.' (beat) You people are such assholes. And now he lapses into silence. Not a happy man.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Don't get so down -- it's not like you're married to him. He'll be gone and you'll have the money.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (miserable) That's not it -- Bret, I don't have the thousand I owe you -- I don't have the money. He has to change rubles to dollars.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: is really upset. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 77 80.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: When? (shaking his head) Now I've got to win three thousand the next couple of days to get the damn twenty-five thousand entrance fee.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: You're in the big game?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: You've got twenty-two thousand? (off Maverick's nod) Cash?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Not frog skins.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: I've never seen that much -where is it, can I see it? On that -Maverick's saddlebag as he goes to it, opens it, out his leather drawstring bag --- Joseph is excited watc Maverick opens the bag -JOSEPH Ha ha. -- after which he goes into shock -- the bag is filled with rolled-up Sears catalog paper. (Lots of AD LIBS.)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: That rotten Annabelle -(big) -- how could she rob me when I was going to face my doom? I could shoot her. -- I will. (drops the now-empty bag -- deep gloom has descended) I'm never gonna make it to that tournament... I'm a dead man.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Goldilocks? (commiserating) You're a dead man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 77

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'm a dead man.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: And now the thing you least expect: a smile.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: No, you really are a dead man. Listen to me... As Maverick looks at him as if he were crazy -78

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 riding his magnificent horse at full gallop through a stream. A couple of braves alongside him. PULL BACK to reveal... A number of tents all of them surrounding something we hadn't expected to see: a large custom wagon (an 1870 motor home). It rests in the middle of a meadow. 80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 Near the wagon as Joseph arrives. It is ornate, filled with artwork of all kinds, clearly Russian in origin. An ARTIST, VILMOS, is painting. The Archduke comes out.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Where's the waterfall?

dialogues.speaker: VILMOS
dialogues.text: I make nature more beautiful. He's the kind of guy if he wasn't so rich and powerful, you'd want to clobber. Spoiled beyond belief, the product Ustinov in Quo Vadis when he played Nero.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Look at his big asshole. (speaking in flawless French

dialogues.speaker: SUBTITLED
dialogues.text: Good afternoon. I hope His Majesty has had a happy day. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 80 82.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: (in flawless French too -- SUBTITLED) I know you were taught by missionaries but I hate it when you speak that way -- it simply isn't authentic. Now do it right.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (raising his right hand) How, white man.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: (English now) Hello, Noble Savage -- I've had a terrible day. I've killed every animal in sight and it's boring me.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: ("too easy") Maybe his largeness be interested in greatest western thrill of all.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Greatest western thrill? it? What? What is

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (motions him to come around) Come. The Archduke and Joseph join at the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: What is greater thrill?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Kill Injun.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Staggered.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Kill... are you crazy? No... No... Oh, I couldn't possibly... is that legal here? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 80

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: If no one find out, very legal. Besides, white man has been doing it for years. (beat) Much wampum needed.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: (into it now) I've never shot anyone before.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Now's your big chance.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Five... thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Would we have to tie him up? doesn't seem sporting. That

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Him loose. But easy hit. Dying anyway. Put out of misery. Much pain.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Deal. Now, as the Archduke starts to get excited -81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 Later in the afternoon. Maverick, magnificently painted to look like an Indian, stands alone. From a distance, in point of fact, he actually looks like an Indian. Now, at the sound of horses, he bends over, groaning, his hands across his stomach as we...

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH AND ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Joseph holds his giant bow and arrow, the Archduke his hunting rifle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 81 84.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Me go give him courage. (as the Archduke starts with him) No -- Indian law say death be private. You wait here. The Archduke nods. Joseph goes to look for Maverick. We see Maverick with all his Indian makeup on.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Bret? Who else?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Did you fix his gun?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Couldn't -- he never let it out of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: -- what's in it for me if I die?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: I got him up to five hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Worth the risk. Okay. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: 250 apiece.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: 250? I'm taking all the risk. What do you need 250 for?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Hey, that's my lucky shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Why don't you ever wash it? stinks. It

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: You wash all the luck out of it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You got a point. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 81

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (calls to Archduke) Soo... Archduke. The Archduke comes to him.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Look sick.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Tell him to start running. Maverick leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Archduke raises his gun.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (moving into the line of fire -shouting) No -- no -- no -- wrong.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: (as Joseph runs up) What's wrong? -(gesturing toward the sky) I don't want to lose the light.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Injun shot by white man's weapon never reach happy hunting ground. (handing over his bow and arrow) Injun must die Injun way.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: (grumpily exchanges weapons) I've never used one of these.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Easy.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: sort of limping along.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Aiming the bow and arrow.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: limping on, groaning brilliantly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 81

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Maverick dead in his sights now --- and he FIRES --- and to him. -- and he stings his hand like hell. shakes his hand. He cries out, Maverick reacts -- tosses his stick and runs. Maverick tears through the forest.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Not bad. (to Maverick in Indian) Not so fast. (in English) You lucky...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: (throwing the bow down, taking his rifle) No wonder you people were so easy to conquer.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (moving in front of the rifle) Two thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Two thousand. You don't think he'll mind missing Heaven?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Not if you shoot fast -And on that they step.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: ONE SHOT RINGS OUT and...

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: screaming in pain, his hands go to his heart. once, falls. He staggers (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 81

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: (thrilled) I killed him. I really killed him. Can we do this again tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) No rest of tribe healthy. back in winter. Come

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: (on his horse now) You're just going to leave him for the vultures?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Never liked him much anyway. Come, we get the money. The Archduke walks. Joseph does bird call. calls back and sneaks a look. 82 Maverick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 Maverick is finishing removing his paint as Joseph rides up. Evening now. Fires all over. Partner.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: We did it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Get away from me you SOB. could have killed me. He

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: We had to make it look real. (handing bow and arrow) Fire. Shoot it. Go on. I saved your life. Maverick does -- same as with the Archduke it hurts.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Hurts, doesn't it? The Archduke's finger was so sore he couldn't shoot anything. (hands 50) Fresh from the mint. You earned it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 82

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'd kiss you, but too many people.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: So on your way. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (wringing his hands still) How'm I going to explain I got away with my hands still attached?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Lie. Tell them you got us all drunk on firewater and escaped in the confusion.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Think anyone will believe that?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: You people will believe anything. (beat) Don't worry -- besides, I got the old dunce up to a thousand dollars. I can pay you what I owe you now.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Why not two thousand?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Be too much.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Just need another twenty-four. He counts.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: Don't insult me by counting it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Sorry, but lately my friends have been stiffing me.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEPH
dialogues.text: (an arm around Maverick) What are friends for...? They react and exit.  MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93

dialogues.speaker: 82A
dialogues.text: Maverick rides away from Village -- crosses stream. 83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 Maverick, riding along a trail going the opposite directi

dialogues.speaker: TURNING IN TRAIL
dialogues.text: Rocks on either side. As he takes it he sees a...

dialogues.speaker: RIDERLESS HORSE
dialogues.text: The rider, face down, lies moaning in deep pain. His body is at a funny angle -- legs could be broken.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: reining in, dismounting.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: GUY ON GROUND
dialogues.text: Groaning is louder.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: kneeling, gently turning the guy over.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: He's the first person we saw in the movie, the guy with the wandering eye who witnessed the hanging.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Has no idea who the guy is.

dialogues.speaker: WANDERING EYE
dialogues.text: He whispers. As Maverick bends close -(CONTINUED)  88. 83

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL AND GUY WITH BURNED FACE
dialogues.text: appearing behind him and while he is unaware, burned face grabs his gun from its holster while Angel delivers a vicious kick to the back of the head.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: falling to the ground, stunned, in sudden pain. starts to rise -- He -- but too late --- Angel delivers another terrible kick in the stomach. Maverick gasps.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Another kick into the stomach. This one harder. Maverick is beginning to go pale. Impossible to breathe now.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Should have paid your cowhands more, Maverick. (and now kicks Maverick brutally in the neck -- ) Lucky for you I'm not the kind who minds being made a fool of. As he gestures for others to join him in beating the hell out of Maverick -ANGEL I never would have let you make the poker game -- but before you done what you done, I might have let you live.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: trying to retaliate as best as he can --- but the attack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky. 84 THUNDER. -- we are back at the shot that ended the opening sequence -(CONTINUED)  89. 84

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 84 -- Maverick's hanging. The rattlers are moving out of the burlap sack. They wriggle closer to Maverick on his horse. His horse is a rock. Maverick struggles to free himself harder than ever, all he's got and more and The rattlers will not stop -- will -- not -- stop -The ho Maverick in desperation increases his efforts. THUNDERCLAPS. Lightning. The rattlers start to curl. Totally without warning, Maverick's horse bolts. Maverick's body drops into space. He hangs helpless in mid-air. The rattlers continue to curl. Maverick fights somehow to free his neck from the noose --- trying somehow to find a way to survive. No good. Not enough breath. His body's struggling becomes more feeble. Then more feeble still. He is a strong and powerful man but in the last hours he has been in gunfights, been beaten half to death --- his Going. Almost gone now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 His body hangs motionless in space. Nothing left. As his eyes start to close -85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the LOUDEST THUNDERCLAP of all. 85 Deafening -- -- and the whole goddam branch Maverick is hanging from is ripped from the tree, and as it falls hard to the ground, Maverick with it --- the rattlers are all around in their midst. He's landed stunned It's impossible to tell which one of them will strike first. Now -TWO GNARLED HANDS That's all we see at first, just the hands. One of them grabs the burlap sack, the other starts scooping up the rattlers, putting them back inside. No fear of consequences. One-two-three-four-five-six, and the rattlers are gone from view. And once they are -PULL BACK to reveal... the MAGICIAN, for that, we will learn, is the name of the woman we are looking at. Little old woman, more precisely. Weird-looking little old woman, more precisely still. She is dressed in clothing that neither fits nor matches. When she talks, she talks very loudly. Clearly she doesn't get a lot of company. Right now she isn't talking at all, just staring at Maverick's still body. Mounted on her strange little cart is the biggest buffalo gun you ever saw. It is what blasted the tree branch to the ground. And smoke still drifts out of the barrel and hangs in the air. Now she takes a foot, pushes Maverick over so he's on his back. Next she aims the huge weapon at Maverick's heart. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a gonna kill you.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Barely able to speak. Still, this latest piece of news is not so much upsetting as it is strange.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (whispered) ... if you're going to do that... why didn't you just let me hang...?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: coming closer.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: 'Cuz then you wouldn't have know'd your crime.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (blinking up) ... who are you...? And what's my crime...?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: I'm nobody -- nobody a-tall -(a bit ticked) -- never mind who I am -- it don't matter a whit who I am -(more) -- how dare you ask who I am? -it's none of your business am -- the subject under discussion is you and your crime -(bigger) -- the crime you're gonna die for -(huge) -- the crime that's gonna condemn you to hell is this: (roaring) You stole my rattlesnakes.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He's just in terrible shape but he didn't think he was going mad.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: ... do I look like a rattlesnake thief? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: (studies Maverick a long while, the huge gun still aimed. Finally she nods) That's exactly what you look like.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You're wrong -- I play cards.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) A gambler? Not in that shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He closes his eyes, tries to laugh --- but he can't. Not but because he is far beyond exhaustion. His body begins to shake, as if with fever. HOLD ON Maverick. Now -86

dialogues.speaker: BIG RATTLESNAKE
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal... the Magician's cabin. he has been ill. Maverick lies on a cot. Clearly, The rattler begins to slither up a leg of the cot on which he lies.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: sitting across the room in a rocking chair.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: (as if to a dog) Henry, you get offa there this minute!

dialogues.speaker: RATTLER
dialogues.text: It knows who's boss. It slithers down the leg of the cot, scots across the room.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: Just as strangely furnished as the Magician is strangely dressed. It's not a small room at all. And on the walls are some beautiful oil paintings. Some gorgeous handmade quilts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 86 On the floor -- a large and obviously expensive oriental rug. In the corner -- several huge bags. Plus one more thing: The whole room is filled with rattlesnakes of varying shapes and sizes.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: eyes slowly opening. He manages to lift his head, take in his surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: ... this hell...?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: No, ya fool, it's my home -- I decided you was too dumb to steal my babies.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: How long I been sick? What day is it?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Son, I lost track of what year it was years ago. Couple days, maybe, maybe more'na couple. (glances at blue bottles over bed) I wouldn't if I was you.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (no clue) Say again?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: You was thinking of stealing my bottles -- don't deny it, the whole world wants my bottles, ain't a bottle collection in a thousand miles equal to mine and I'm telling you true, you so much as touch one, I'll have you fanged to death. (beat) You was almost hung.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I was there, I remember. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: That's what got you off your feed, rest a little, you'll be fine. Gets up, comes over, looks down at Maverick. Maverick's eyes are closed again before the sentence is finished. Now -87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 The Magician cooking at the stove in another corner of her home.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He sits in a chair at a small wooden table with two chairs. A thick blanket is thrown across his shoulders. The Magician brings him a plate of food. Or at least a plate of something. Maverick looks at it suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What do you call this?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: It don't pay to ask too many questions.

dialogues.speaker: PLATE
dialogues.text: At least nothing looks alive.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He takes a bite; that's enough.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: You'll wanna get your strength back. Maverick says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What do you call this?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: It's one of my specialties.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (toys with it, doesn't eat) I'm really not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (doesn't get it) Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: (roaring suddenly) I was not addressing you. Now shut up. (quiet tone) What do you think... Henry? (beat; listening) You do? -- That's interesting. (to Maverick) Henry thinks you deserve to be punished -- Henry thinks all people who are rude and insulting to me deserve to be punished -(building) -- did you grow the food that made your meal? No. Did you cook the food that made your meal? No. Did you know it was something I was proud of? Yes. I told you it was a speciality but you decided, 'What does she know, she doesn't look like such a great chef to me, why should I eat her speciality?' (roaring again) You should eat it because you're a guest in my house and I worked hard to please you -- now we'll try it again, you ask what it is and I say it's a speciality, now what do you say? I'll tell you what you say. You say 'Yum.' Can you handle that?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Yum. (beat) Should I rub my tummy too?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Suddenly laughing.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Now that was funny. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 Suddenly she whaps his ear hard like he was misbehaving in school.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: I hate funny people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to take small spoonfuls now. isn't in it -- But his heart

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: You'll want to get your strength back.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: And this is the first time we've ever seen him like this: He's down. The optimism, the good-hearted quality that has always been with him -- that's gone.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Right now, I don't know what I need it for. See, there's gonna be a poker championship -twenty-five thousand entra fee. Poker's what I've done all my life and I wanted to know how good I was. Once and for all. (beat) Got robbed. What I had's probably been spent. Game may have started already for all I know.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Lemme tell you something true -money ain't worth shit.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Long pause. Then --

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: It wasn't the money... it was the knowing. HOLD ON Maverick. 88 Then --

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. THE MAGICIAN'S CABIN
dialogues.text: 88 There's a strange feel to it. It's sunny but there's THUNDER. Huge clouds scud across the horizon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 88 Two chairs set up alongside a large tree stump. sits in one of them, staring at the sky. Maverick The ground around him is filled with rattlers, taking in the sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: carrying a couple of the large bags we saw in a corner. They're heavy, causing a problem for her. She has a large pistol tucked into her belt. Maverick is unarmed. Maverick is starting to look like himself again. His problem is the rattlers. He eyes them suspiciously as The Magician walks toward him.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: (spotting the look) Oh, don't worry none. They're sweet as pie -(beat) -- least, of course, I tell them to bite.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: But you wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: (means this) Do it in a fingersnap if people rile me.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND
dialogues.text: as she puts the bags down --- a few RATTLERS HISS, slithe The Magician sits in the other chair.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Been thinking about your finances. (pointing to a bag) Guess what's in here? (big) The answer to your troubles.

dialogues.speaker: BAG
dialogues.text: as she opens it, pours out its contents. It's shit -- worthless -- tin plates, cups, ladles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Some of them's real old -(pronounces this next anti-ques) -- antiques.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I don't think the champion will accept -(beat) -- even genuine anti-ques.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: There he goes again, right, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What'd I do this time?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: We're only on this earth to help each other -- when I say something wrong, you ought to help me -- you ought to say, 'I think it's pronounced antiques.' Do it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I think it's pronounced 'antiques.'

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Well, isn't that interesting, thank you for the tip. And on that, she belts him hard on the ear, like a schoolmistress to a recalcitrant child. Maverick just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: I'm your hostess, ya fool, what right you got correcting me?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: But you said -THE MAGICIAN Never pay attention to what I say -(beat; taking the second sack) -- now listen carefully -As she opens it:

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Oh good, more plates. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Shocked. And we find out why as we:

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: holding the other bag wide -- and it's stuffed with cash. The Magician grabs a handful, holds it out. It's tied up in a bundle.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: I got twenty-five times twentyfive thousand in here. (slaps the money down on the tree trunk) There's more'n your entrance fee right there. Counted it out last night. The two of them, the money and tree stump between them. And of course, the SNAKES HISSING contentedly on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Incredible.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Nah -- I been a hermit here forty years -- this is rough country, lot of people die. When I find 'em I keep what looks valuable. (picks up the bundle of money, holds it out) Want it? No loan or nothing, I'd just give it to you. I'd like that. Maverick reaches for the money --- The Magician pulls it

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: (roaring) Now I ain't no fool -- I want something in return -MAVERICK What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: I want for you to do magic.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Nothing makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: tossing the money back and forth as she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: See, when I was little -(pauses; then starts to cackle) -- I am little, I meant when I was young -- yes I was once, a child -anyway, animals was alw not dogs, not cats, different kinds, butterflies liked me, bees used to follow me around, and people thought I was magical but I wasn't, I just treated everything the way I wanted to be treated, if you're nice to bees, cordial and all, well, they like it, something most people don't realize 'cause most people don't take the time, where was I? -MAVERICK I have no idea whatsoever -THE MAGICIAN (mutters a moment, then) Magic! It's inside you, somewhere it is, I know that.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You don't know a thing about me.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: (roaring) I know what you was blabbing when you was sick!

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (can't remember) What did I say? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: You did magic with the ace of sapdes, I want to know about it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) That was personal.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: I really am interested! (pistol is out -but only briefly; puts it back) Nah -- I saved you too often already to kill you now. But you owe me.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (soft) I guess I do.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: What was so personal about it?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: My mother was dying and I wanted to please her before she left. (remembering) I thought I had magic that day. (beat) But I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: A reverie.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I had a way with cards, even when I was little -- she used to like me to do tricks. (beat) And that last day -- I was doing the usual -- but then I felt I had to be special for -- I said I would close my eyes and cut her the ace of spades -- it was her favorite card. Whenever I'd ask her to think of a card, she always said 'ace of spades.' (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Watching. The snakes are moving around her chair. She gestures for them to stop -- instantly, they go still.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Still in the reverie.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I closed my eyes and she shuffled and I cut -(beat) -- but I failed. Got a spade, but it was just the nine, anyone can do that.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: I'll get some cards. This time you'll cut the ace for sure.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: It won't work.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Try.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'm not going to do it. I'm not going to fail again -- get that through your head.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: as suddenly she makes a sound we haven't heard from her before and -RATTLERS starting to go wild and -MAVERICK staring, frozen -MAVERICK Maybe I will give it a shot after all. The Magician makes another strange sound. calm own. The snakes (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Somehow I figured you might change your mind. Now, from that -DECK OF CARDS The Magician is finishing shuffling. She plops them down on the tree trunk, makes a neat pile. PULL BACK to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK AND THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: seated across from each other. The snakes are all around -- they seem fascinated, all of them facing the tree trunk. Maverick eyes the snakes -- they don't do much for his peace of mind or his confidence -- but clearly, he has no confidence anyway.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: She places the wad of money next to the cards, gestures for Maverick to start. He hesitates, then -MAVERICK He starts breathing more deeply. It's almost as if he's trying to enter a different state. He stares up -GIANT CLOUDS moved by the wind.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: waiting.

dialogues.speaker: RATTLESNAKES
dialogues.text: waiting.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Voice almost in a reverie.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I loved my mother a whole lot... she was everything you could want -(CONTINUED)  104. 88

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: You stalling?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Well, quit it!

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He puts his hands in his lap. It's as if he's trying to go into a deep trance now. He's breathing deeply. wind turns into MUSIC. And now something strange: the A gorgeous theme. It plays on.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: caught up in it, watching. The snakes seems caught up in it too -- they aren't watching the cards anymore; they're turned to Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: And now he closes his eyes. His breathing grows very deep. The wind MUSIC is louder, more beautiful. He drops his hands into his lap. His head lolls back -- and suddenly the music is gone ---

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I was trying to go somewhere in my mind. Couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: I was watching -- you were getting into a trance -- you were almost there.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (dubious) You just want it to happen, that's all -- nothing felt right.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: You give up too fast -- if magic was easy, everyone would do it. You want to win that poker thing, don't you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Well, you're not gonna win nothing without a spot deep inside that tells you it's okay. A spot that says, 'Be a fool if you want, just be the best fool around, and I'll stay with you forever.'

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I don't want to be a fool.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: You think when I was little and playing with dolls I thought, 'I can't wait to grow up so I can be a hermit and have rattlesnakes for friends?'

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: I was whipped and beaten and left to die and I could have, but that spot talked to me, it told me, 'No, don't let the world piss on you, it's okay to live alone, rattlers don't talk back and they're more honest than most people, get a move on.' (beat) Now I'm a great hermit and I wouldn't be nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: RATTLERS
dialogues.text: They have been watching The Magician. at Maverick. Now they look

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (soft) I was whipped and beaten and left to die.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Point of my story.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: For a moment, he doesn't move at all. Then he sits deeper in the chair again, closes his eyes, breathes deep, deeper. The wind MUSIC is back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 His hands are limp in his lap. The music is glorious.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Watching. She picks up a rattler, strokes it for luck, puts it back.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: His voice strange. The MUSIC CONTINUES through this.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: ... right hand...

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Take it. Lift it. (as the Magician obeys) Now put it on the cards. The Magician obeys.

dialogues.speaker: CARDS
dialogues.text: on the tree stump, Maverick's hand, still limp, resting on them --- then the hand gains tension --- the fingers m

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: God knows where he is now but he's a long way from here. The breathing deep, regular; the eyes shut. The wind music has never been as fine.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: watching Maverick's hand; it moves as if it had a life of its own.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK'S HAND
dialogues.text: It stops.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Voice stranger than before. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: ... right hand...

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: ... lift it... (as The Magician obeys) ... turn it... (as The Magician obeys) ... look... The Magician stares.

dialogues.speaker: CARD
dialogues.text: -- and he's done it! --- cut the ace of spades --- at lea But on second glance, it's clear he's missed. cian holds the ace of clubs. The Magi-

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Eyes open now, sees he's failed again. dead, gone. Exhausted, he stares. The wind music is

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: and she's never looked happy before. money, shoves it at Maverick. She grabs the

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Give you my best horse too.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Why? I failed again. You were wrong about me.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: My lord, you are the dumbest creature on the planet -(now she grabs his hand) -- not to mention you give up too soon. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE MAGICIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (she drops his hand back on the deck) Lift it.

dialogues.speaker: NEXT CARD
dialogues.text: It was the ace of spades.

dialogues.speaker: MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Next time you'll get it right --- maybe the time after th time. But you got magic inside you -- knew it all along -- that's what makes me a great hermit -(beat) I know things. (throwing more money at Maverick) Buy yourself some clothes that fit -- thank me I'll kill you -(she grabs up Henry) -- now get outta my life. (sweetly, to Henry) Yes... there's a good baby, yes... Maverick reaches down, lifts her, kisses her, puts her back --- and she whaps him hard across the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: MAGICIAN
dialogues.text: Never did like being kissed by strange men. (beat) And you're very strange... She starts to cackle at her joke, closes her eyes, strokes Henry happily -* 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 An explosion of people and noise. We are on the front deck of a riverboat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 89 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 We're on the Columbia River on a gorgeous afternoon. Off by the railing, a brass band blasts away. Behind them is a sign reading:

dialogues.speaker: ALL RIVER'S POKER CHAMPIONSHIP
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal the town they have left. 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 Maverick, moving across the front deck. another flight of stairs. He makes his way through the crowd. again, wears new clothes -- Ahead of him is He looks terrific -- not to mention a new shirt. This one fits. makes his way toward the staircase -- As he And on that -91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91 Annabelle, for it was her voice, as she goes to him. She's thrilled he's there, holds him, kisses his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Bret?! Bret Maverick!! Oh my god! My very own hero, alive and well. She checks his body.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You seem glad to see me... I'm not exactly a whole man anymore. He holds up his right hand, which is up his sleeve, he reveals it into her face and she screams. She clutches it to her breast and then realizes its intimacy and slaps him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: How did you ever escape from those hostiles? He doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Have I done something to offend you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 91 110.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Mrs. Bransford, I like to think I enjoy a prank as much as the next man, but have you no memory of robbing me blind as I went off to face death with the Indians?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (hurt) If you ever believed anything I told you, believe this -- I did not do it... (as Maverick isn't buying -- he just stares her down) ... then.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Then?... Then when and why?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had to protect my fifty percent.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Fifty percent? Last I heard it was thirty. It was forty. about it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I feel real terrible

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Not terrible enough to give it back.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (fiddle-de-dee) I hope nothing ever makes me feel that terrible.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD AROUND THEM
dialogues.text: Maverick spots someone but the guy turns away so that we're not totally sure who it was.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK AND ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: She's looking around too. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 91

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Oh Bret, my beautiful perfect male, I don't want to seem ungrateful but why did you omit that three thousand dollars?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Did I do that? I'm sorry, I didn't mean to stiff you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (looking around again) I've only been able to break even these last days at the poker tables.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You mean you can't enter?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (she can't) And my poor pure heart was so set on it. Maverick. Without hesitation...

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Well, set on this! You stay just as pure as you can! Exit line because he has spotted the Duke.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Delighted. Grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Is there no end to your goodness?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I've always been a sucker for a pretty face with a sad story.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Heaven will welcome you for this. (puts it in her purse) Now tell me how you escaped.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Got 'em all drunk and slipped out in the confusion. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 91

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: How could I not adore you?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You're irresistible -ANNABELLE (nods) -- how true.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (leaving her) Make me proud. As he goes -91A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maverick, moving through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: 91A
dialogues.text: Now --

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: we didn't quite see before as Maverick taps him.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Excuse me, folks. Could I have a word with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It's the Archduke, very surprised at being treated this way.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I know who I am and that's what matters -(beat) -- Maverick, Indian Affairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indians? They walk away to be private.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: It's over for you, Dukey -- Joseph talked.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: I don't know anyone by that name. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: That's funny. That's what he said about you when I started investigating the murder. Once I jailed him, he told the truth. And I think you will too.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: But I am no American.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Murder is murder, Dukey... minimum of ten years and a three thousand dollar fine.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: (desperate) Shit... I have three thousand dollars right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes out a wallet.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You know the penalty for bribing someone in Indian Affairs?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: (panicked) I was going home anyway. (practically throwing three thousand at Maverick) This way I pay my dues and save you the cost of the trial.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (hesitant) Court is overworked, I admit it. (beat) Give you a break -- Don't shoot anymore Indians. Maverick takes the money.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE
dialogues.text: He starts off, stops, looks closely at Maverick's face.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHDUKE

When he smiles, which comes easily, it's very winning. He's bright, shrewd, and has been a leader all his life. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE, (COMMODORE DEVOL)
dialogues.text: Welcome to my ship and the First Ever Annual Championship. The only reason it exists is because I have every intention of winning it. (smiles) Some of you know me. Some of you even like me. 'Course, some of you are probably fools. (as there is laughter; he acknowledges it happily) The truth is this: I'm a great businessman and a great poker player which, along with my great natural modesty, makes me so enchanting. (now he turns serious) Rules are simple. We play 'til we drop. Winner takes all. Dealer can call one break of one half hour. Soon as you're busted, you're gone. Twenty of us are playing which means there's gonna be nineteen broken hearts. Because I plan on winning it all -- half a million cash -- by morning. And ON as before.
