dialogues.text: (as the Tough Dealer nods) Then why don't I just do that. (beat) Five thousand, Mister Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Stares glumly.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Silly for me to match that.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: says nothing. She gives away none of the tells she had earlier that Maverick told her about. Just sits there blankly, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: folds his hand, gets set to toss it into the pile. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: couldn't be more disinterested.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: at the last second, pulling his hand back.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I guess I feel like being silly. (pushes chips into the pot) Beat two pair and it's yours. Shows her his cards -- tens and threes -CLOSEUP - ANNABEL She stares across at him now with fury.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Bastard. And with that, she flings her cards down -- she's been bluffing.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: gathering in the pot.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: I'm out of the game. (as Maverick says nothing -- louder) You just put me out of the game. (as Maverick stacks the chips silently; still louder) I didn't do either of my two giveaways -- I never touched my thumb with my little finger and I never once flicked my teeth -MAVERICK -- you have three -- you always toss your head when you bluff -ANNABELLE (exploding) You didn't tell me that one!

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You never want to give everything away, Mrs. Bransford. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Well, I'll just try and pretend it was someone else's money. 144

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 144 She takes a deep breath, gets herself back in control. Then, a lady again, she smiles graciously at the Commodore, stands up, moves to Coop. As she distracts people, The Angel and the Tough Dealer exchange a glance. Coop catches it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: It's as if he hadn't seen the glance.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: moving closer to the table, circling, checking.

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH DEALER
dialogues.text: casually dealing away.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: casually watching him. 145

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 145 -- only now we see him through Maverick's eyes -- and what he's doing, and doing brilliantly, is manipulating the cards. Sometimes he deals from the top, sometimes the bottom, sometimes the second card, sometimes the third, and sometimes from the middle of the deck which is brutally hard.

dialogues.speaker: TABLE
dialogues.text: back in regular motion as the Dealer finishes. Here is how the players are sitting: To the left of The Dealer, the first one to bet is Stuttering. Then Twitchy. After him, The Commodore, next, The Angel. Last, Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: STUTTERING
dialogues.text: as he looks at his cards -(CONTINUED)  135. 145

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 145 -- he's been dealt a straight -- two, three, four, five, six -- of different suits. A sensational hand. Nothing shows on his face as he gestures to Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Stuttering opens with two-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: OTHERS
dialogues.text: It's a considerable opener.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: who is checking out the hands. He whispers to Annabelle.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Game's over, Stuttering's got a straight. (looks at the next hand -Twitchy's) My God, it isn't over, Twitchy wins it -ANNABELLE (surprised) What with?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Flush.

dialogues.speaker: TWITCHY
dialogues.text: And now we see his hand -- five hearts. All parts of his face are in motion as he matches Stuttering's bet.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Checking The Commodore.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (whispering) They're both dead -- full house.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: Two tens and three nines. The best yet.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: Call me a fool, but I think I'll raise a thousand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Coop can't see his hand; he keeps it hidden.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Raise ten thousand.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: as we see his hand. spades -- The ten, jack, queen, king of -- plus the two of diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: COOP AND ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: She indicates Maverick.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: He's got shit. (can't help it, he's sorry) Don't give up on the boy -- at least it's shit with potential.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He stays, pushing chips into the pot. So do the other three.

dialogues.speaker: POT
dialogues.text: A lot of chips. Over fifty thousand dollars' worth. The Tough Dealer. To Stuttering.

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH DEALER
dialogues.text: How many cards? Stuttering smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He stands. Twitchy nods.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: One. He gets it from the Dealer, looks at it, seems concerned. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH DEALER
dialogues.text: (to Maverick) You?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Quietly -MAVERICK Same -(then his hand suddenly covers the Tough Dealer's) -- but I don't want it from you.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: What're you pulling, son?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I want a new dealer -- and I want a new shuffle -- and I want a new cut. The Commodore looks to Coop.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Within his rights. shuffle -- I'll

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: -- I'll cut.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) No. Him. (indicating The Angel) He cuts.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: smiles.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: I kind of like that. Shows trust. Coop shuffles the cards quickly, hands them over.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Throat dry. starts. He sits back in his chair. The WIND MUSIC (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: His huge hand slowly cuts the cards.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: watching.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Annabelle beside him. the cut. Watching, as The Angel finishes

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: And now he closes his eyes. He seems, at this tense momen still. He listens a moment more, then opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DECK
dialogues.text: as now The Angel takes a single finger, pushes the top card across the table to Maverick. Who does an amazing thing --- he doesn't look at it. Just leaves it face down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYERS
dialogues.text: who look to Stuttering to begin the betting. holds up two fingers, wide apart. Stuttering

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Two thousand. Stuttering puts two thousand in the pot -- Twitchy watches it.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: Raise five thousand. As the chips go into the growing pot -THE ANGEL He looks about to fold -- then he suddenly smiles at Maverick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: I liked it when you did that to the lady. (chips in) Raise twenty thousand.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK'S LAST CARD
dialogues.text: Still face down. Maverick hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: I'd look at it, son.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: No need. (chips into pot) Raise twenty-five.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: exploding.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: What kind of act you pulling? -- look at your card. Maverick says not a word.

dialogues.speaker: STUTTERING
dialogues.text: He pushes in all the chips he has left.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Stuttering calls.

dialogues.speaker: TWITCHY
dialogues.text: (to Stuttering -apologetically) Solly. He pushes more chips in than Stuttering had.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: We're saying good-bye to the boys now. (as all his chips go in) Fifty thousand more.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Studying his hand. And for the first time we see it -(CONTINUED)  140. 145

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 145 -- Five, six, seven, eight, nine. All of diamonds. A straight flush.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: (to Maverick) Want to see me, it'll cost you everything you got. (pushes in all his chips too, a huge amount) Hundred and fifty thousand. Half a million in the pot if you match it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Still doesn't look at his last card. chips in silently. Half a million in the pot. Just pushes all his It's gigantic.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Turning over his cards.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD AROUND TABLE
dialogues.text: Stunned. It's a phenomenal hand.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Silently turns over the cards we've seen. Ten of spades. Jack of spades. Queen of spades. King of spades.

dialogues.speaker: LAST CARD
dialogues.text: The one he hasn't looked at. Now he slides it toward him, starts to take a quick glance --- but first he close the WIND MUSIC --- only now, without warning, it GOES SOU DIES. Then it (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Eyes open fast and now you can see it, his confidence isn't there. He grabs the card, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Stunned.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (hardly able to talk) ... I... just don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: TABLE
dialogues.text: The Angel reaches for the pot.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Strange things happen at the poker table.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (hard to hear him) ... I know... (beat) ... but... (beat) ... who ever dreamed of two straight flushes in the same hand -- lucky for me mine's higher.

dialogues.speaker: CARD
dialogues.text: as he flips it up into the air. It spins down. The ace of spades.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Dead pale as a wild fury begins and...

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: exploding and...

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: standing and... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: running into his arms, hugging him and -ANNABELLE Now that you're rich, I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: and in the instant Annabelle's in Maverick's arms he's screaming.

dialogues.speaker: THE ANGEL
dialogues.text: Miserable cheating son of a bitch -And as he starts to rise, draws a gun -- and we're SLOW MOTION.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: in Annabelle's arms is helpless -ANNABELLE sees what's coming, but it's too late -THE ANGEL is about to fire when --- his shirt is suddenly bloody an

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: stands there, watching Angel die, his gun in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: out of Annabelle's arms now sees movement in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL'S TWO HELPERS
dialogues.text: are getting set to fire.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: grabs Coop's other gun --- draws like lightning, FIRES TW  143. 145

dialogues.speaker: TWO HELPERS
dialogues.text: are done.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK AND COOP
dialogues.text: return both Coop's guns to their holsters at exactly the same time. We go back into REGULAR MOTION now. 146

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 148 The satchel, with the money inside. PULL BACK to reveal: Coop, pulling it out of the safe, standing -COOP Sorry, Bret, wish your moment could have lasted a little longer, but there it is --- and his gun is back in his ha open window.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: He hadn't expected this -- ever.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: his gun ready.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I feel real bad about this but I saw all that money and, well, shit, I just wanted it -And on that -WINDOW -- he vaults gracefully out and -149

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 149 A small boat waits -- tied to the riverboat -- Coop races to it, leaps on, the small boat turns into the current and pulls away downstream.  MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93

dialogues.speaker: 149A
dialogues.text: Inside the salon -- this has all gone like a streak and what we have here now is confusion and chaos. The Commodore races out of the main cabin -150

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 150 The Commodore races down the deck with his rifle and stops at the railing.

dialogues.speaker: 150A
dialogues.text: As Coop gets further away The Commodore takes aim with th rifle. A hand COMES IN to knock it aside.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (soft) Let him go.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: ... Let him go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commodore stares at Maverick; so does Annabelle. There is a crowd gathering.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (addressing the crowd, quieting it) The man saved my life. I can always win more money. (beat) Besides, I found out what I came for anyway.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: raising his hands. He controls the room.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: (to Maverick) That's a half a million dollars, son. Do I have to remind you of that?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Do I have to remind you it's my half million? It's only money. It's not worth taking a life over.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: Only money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Coop probably never had a dishonest thought 'til this happened. And for the rest of his days. He's going to be haunted whatever we do. And that's punishment enough for a man. I won't swear out a warrant against him.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: (to the crowd -unexpectedly moved) I'll be damned... I'll be damned. I know a little something about money -- made a lot in my lifetime, gonna make a lot more. But this young man has more wisdom now about what's really valuable than I'll ever have. I had two wives leave me on account of my obsession with making money. (almost in tears -to Maverick) Don't you ever change. (now, raising an imaginary glass -toasting) To a champion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All on board echo The Commodore's toast.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: as Annabelle joins him; doing his best to keep his emotions in check -- but no question about it, at this moment, he is a proud young man. Now, from that -151

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 151 Annabelle, her eyes closed. She's in Maverick's room and he is taking off her suit coat. He lays it over a chair. She stands as before, in skirt and expensive blouse.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: When can I open my eyes? -- what is this gift I'm getting?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (soft) Just one minute more -(CONTINUED)  MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 151 146.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 151 And on that -MAVERICK as he suddenly grabs her lovely blouse and rips it wide open --- Annabelle, shocked, cries out, opens her eyes, h hands trying to cover her suddenly revealed body --- but Over her slip she is wearing the most Rube Goldberg-like thing you ever saw. (It was called the Kepplinger Holdout remarkable number of cards. The thing worked, believe it or not, by using the knees, and is generally thought of as being the greatest card-cheating device of the past century.)

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I didn't wear it 'til the break -MAVERICK -- and you didn't have to. Here's my gift to you: the truth. You were one of the six best players out there. (pulling the holdout off her) Get rid of this.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (confused, embarrassed, touched) Would you believe me if I told you it didn't work? Look -- all the cards are still there -Contraption just jammed on me, couldn't get it to function. (now, as her arms go around Maverick) Let's hope I have better luck with you. As they fall on the bed -KEPPLINGER HOLDOUT As suddenly, on its own, it starts working. An ace of spades rises, BLOCKING OUR VIEW. HOLD ON the card, then -  MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 152 147.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 152 There are several carriages and various horses waiting. Maverick and Annabelle, are by a waiting carriage. is good-bye and neither of them is all that happy. This

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Where you headed?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (a shrug -- she doesn't know) Someplace else.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I'm going there too. Want to travel together? I could use the protection.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Long pause. Then --

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: No. It would be wonderful, we could fight all the time. But I wouldn't learn anything about my tells now, would I? Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: TWO OF THEM
dialogues.text: A final embrace. Meaningful. They kiss. She gets into the carriage and Maverick closes the door. The Driver gets on his seat.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Annabelle? She turns back. from her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a wallet he's just taken

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: (impressed) That was good. You're getting better. (beat) Bert. Now she hands him his watch she's taken.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You are the best at that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: You are the best at this. She kisses him. The carriage takes off. watches and steps away. Maverick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The half million in cash. satchel is alongside. 153 Separated into two piles. The PULL BACK to reveal: Coop, nervously waiting alone in a rocky place on the edge of nowhere. A small fire is the only illumination. A stream flows by. Now, the sound of a WALKING SLOWLY. The sound STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coop draws his GUN, COCKS it -- it makes a distinct sound --- KUH -- LICK --- he stares out into the darkness Then he relaxes, puts the gun back into its holster.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Where the hell you been? PULL BACK to reveal: The Coomodore. He moves to the fire.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: I had to say good-bye. I couldn't risk looking like I was rushing any place. I took a lot of twists and turns, backtracking a lot. Made sure nobody was following me. You don't seem happy to see me.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (angry) I thought you and me were in this thing together -- you win, I do nothing. Someone else wins, I do what I did. Why didn't you tell me Angel was in it too? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: What did Maverick say to that sweet young thing? 'You never want to give everything away.' If Angel'd won, we'd still have split it the same way. I telegraphed him -- keep Maverick from the game. He messed that up. Poor dead bastard.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: I just don't like secrets.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: Then you probably won't like this one either.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: as suddenly he draws his gun, cocks it --- there's that s

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: I guess it's just my greedy nature. But I've decided not to share it with you -COOP (shocked) A deal's a deal.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: In a perfect world, that's true. (throws Coop's gun in the water, ready to fire) I just want you to know I've never worked with a more honest man in my life. Now -- A familiar sound:

dialogues.speaker: -- KUH
dialogues.text: I wouldn't give odds on it being a long one. Uncock it. As they spin -(CONTINUED)  MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 153

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: moving fast, gun drawn. With speed and precision he grabs The Commodore's pistol. They raise their hands as he gestures for them to sit close together.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Sit down, gentlemen. Let's get cozy. Have a parley. Put your hands down. You look ridiculous. I almost fell asleep with boredom following you -- you and that idiot speech about my wisdom -how could you expect me to for that? You must think I'm awful damn dumb. (to Coop) But you... you fooled me. And not many can. But you saved me, so I won't kill you. (beat) Just remember, the whole world knows what you are. That's punishment enough. All your life's work, all the good you did, you wiped it away. You don't have anything to show for it.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: You're young, so you don't know that much about mistakes, but you're making one now.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: You can't leave me alive.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: And we've never seen him like this -- out of control.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: What you said, every word, that's right -- I traded every decent thing I know for that money -(building) -- and you better believe I'm coming for it! (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 153

dialogues.speaker: COOP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (bigger) I don't care where you go, one night you'll relax -- and guess who'll be there waiting?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Puts the satchel full of money down.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You couldn't sneak up on a corpse, Coop; not anymore. You're just another decrepit old has-been.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: scared, as Maverick studies his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: It's a problem -- if I don't kill you, what do I do?

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: watching, the fury still there.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: a shrug.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: What the heck!

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: His hands fiddle a little with the gun, we can't really see what he's doing. Then he points the gun at the Commodore, as if to shoot him, then, at the last minute he flicks the GUN to the side and SHOOTS. The bullet just misses the Commodore and scares him very badly.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Maybe the fairest thing would be to just let one of you kill the other -- I'll let you decide which... And with that -(CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 153

dialogues.speaker: GUN
dialogues.text: as he heaves it high, high into the air and -COOP AND THE staring up after it and -MAVERICK watching them, satchel in hand, gun drawn, backing away and -GUN spinning in the night and -COOP still staring up, beginning to guess where it might land and -THE COMMODORE watching Coop and -MAVERICK The shadows have him and he's gone and -COOP starting to move and -GUN beginning its arc down and -THE COMMODORE suddenly sticking a leg out, tripping Coop and -COOP beginning to fall and -THE COMMODORE heading for where the gun might fall and -GUN dropping fast and -(CONTINUED)  MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 153

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: And he gets his balance, quickly goes into a roll, bounces up, breaks into a run and -THE COMMODORE no match for Coop's speed but -GUN landing, and -COOP the first one there, grabbing it, whirling and -- it slips from Coop's hand!!!

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: can't believe his luck! The gun has been flung straight into his hand. He quickly points the gun at Coop and smiles with a deadly smile.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: Well, that -- as they say, is that! And the Commodore pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: CLICK
dialogues.text: nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CLICK, CLICK, CLICK
dialogues.text: There are no bullets in the gun! Now obviously outclassed, the Commodore knows that he is a dead man. Panic starts.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: That Maverick... son of a bitch... Coop stand up and knocks the gun out of the Commodore's hand. He punches him in the stomach and knocks his hat off. Coop punches him in the face and the Commodore is knocked over a log. The Commodore tries to get up over the log. Coop hits him with an uppercut and knocks him over and on his back. Coop picks up a stick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAVERICK - Rev. 11/15/93 153

dialogues.speaker: THE COMMODORE
dialogues.text: Please... no... no...

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: You double-crossing... If I ever so much as hear your name... if I ever hear you're in the same town as me so I might see your face... If I ever get wind that you've hired another Angel or any of your assassins. I never did a coldblooded murder in my life an won't till I find Maverick... He throws the stick down and walks. hat and goes out. He picks up his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 154 A large communal bathroom in a fancy hotel. tubs, some sinks, thick towels. A couple of (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 154 It is the towels that alert us to where we are, for on them is embroidered the name of the hotel: THE SAN FRANCISCAN. Maverick lies happily in one of the tubs. Eyes closed. His clothes are piled nearby. His gun too. And alongside He is at peace, listening to the sound of the WIND MUSIC -Now another sound cuts through --- KUH -- LICK -Ma standing there with the drop on Maverick. smiling. He isn't

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Decrepit has-been?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Not a sound.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: closing in. Louder.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Couldn't sneak up on a corpse?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (beat) Actually, I kind of liked that one.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: watching as Coop holsters his gun.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: Lucky for you I have a forgiving nature.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I take it the Commodore will not be a problem. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: It was worth everything to nail that crooked bastard.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: My pappy always said nothing was a deeper religious experience than cheating a cheater.

dialogues.speaker: COOP
dialogues.text: (big) Now I never once said that -- you been misquoting me all your life and I'm sick of it -MAVERICK You say such dumb things I've got to improve them. As they look at each other -155

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 155 A deck of cards. It is being manipulated dazzlingly with one hand -- exactly as Maverick did before in the stagecoach. PULL BACK to reveal: We are in exactly the same spot as before only now it is Coop that is manipulating the cards. Both men lie relaxed, eyes closed, in tubs. sense of peace and harmony. There is a

dialogues.speaker: TWO OF THEM
dialogues.text: relaxed. We are looking at both of their backs. Now that sound again --- KUH -- LICK -MAVERICK (doesn't bother opening his eyes or turning) Satchel's right here. And on that, as both men open their eyes -(CONTINUED)  156. 155

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: her gun aimed at them. She moves fast, grabbing their guns, their clothes. Then the satchel -ANNABELLE (tossing something to Maverick who catches it -- it's a silk shirt) Hope it fits -- just know it's the best San Francisco has to offer.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: (touched) Isn't that sweet?

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (snarling) Get hold of yourself, she's robbing us.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: What a remarkable family.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (to Coop) How'd she figure that?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Give me some credit -- you don't own the exclusive on tells -(rattling it off as Maverick had done with her) -- you're both the same height, you've got the same build, you've got the same eyes, you both kiss the same way, you both draw your guns the same way -(a breath) -- and you both sing the same wrong words to 'Amazing Grace.' Now, she studies their naked bodies in the tubs.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABELLE
dialogues.text: Oh my yes, there are just a lot of splendid similarities... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 155 She smiles her dazzling smile, goes to the door, opens it, blows a kiss -- impossible to say to which man -and g

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK AND PAPPY
dialogues.text: They stare at the door a moment. Neither of them seems anxious to get moving or particularly upset.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: Woman with her looks can't hide.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (nods) Whenever we decide to catch her -(snaps his fingers) -- it's done.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: (nods too) The truth? If someone had to rob us, I'm glad it was my little Annie. He's never called her that before.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: as this registers.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Your little what? (beat) I'll tell you the real truth -every time you got near her was... (squints) ... I'm looking for the right word -- you are, after all, the man who raised me and I hold you in the highest respect... (beat) It was disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: as this registers.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: (chuckles) My my, green with envy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TWO OF THEM
dialogues.text: some heat now.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: You're right. (beat) After all, when she's a hundred, you'll only be a hundred and thirty-five.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: I would be careful if I were you -just know that splendid was almost your stepmother.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: She was a lot closer to being your daughter-in-law.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: Would have been sheer disaster -you're totally lacking in maturity needed to satisfy a woman like that.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Not what she said.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: I know what she said about you -and I would never humilia repeating those terrible words.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: Neither do I. Now they both start to laugh, lie back. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: What we ended up with is one half million dollar silk shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: Quarter of a million's more like it -- I mixed in a Sears catalog along with the cash -Annabelle'll enjoy that. (beat) Hope you enjoy this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: as he takes a quarter of a million in cash from his boot and hands it to his father.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: There are no words for what he feels, but you know he is deeply moved by the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: pleased and proud.

dialogues.speaker: TWO OF THEM
dialogues.text: as Pappy takes the money, holds it in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: (soft; an emotional moment is on the horizon) ... Bret... son...

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (quiet) Yessir?

dialogues.speaker: PAPPY
dialogues.text: (zap) This feels like you shorted me -I'm going to count it bac room.

dialogues.speaker: MAVERICK
dialogues.text: (zap) That might take the rest of the week since we all know your trouble with counting once you get past your fingers and toes. They look at each other. And then they smile. Then -- And lie silent for a moment. CAMERA begins to PULL BACK. and now Maverick begins to hum "Amazing Grace." Pappy joins him, doing the harmony. CAMERA continues PULLING BACK. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 155 Maverick starts to sing the song. Pappy joins him, doing the harmony. It's just lovely. 156

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156 CAMERA PULLS BACK and OUT the window to reveal the exterior of the beautiful hotel and the city of San Francisco. The two of them sing on. clear. Their voices ring out loud and They've never sounded better. Let's leave them there... FINAL FADE OUT.
